About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is allowing these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their wildest dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand a small dry goods business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años vende  ropa y bisutería, productos que ofrece a su compañeros de trabajo, ya que es enfermera de profesión y trabaja en un hospital de su ciudad. De esta manera vende sus productos a crédito, además conoce la calidad de clientes que tiene, por eso no se preocupa, sabe que ellos son muy puntuales en el pago. Se siente satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, ya que le permite tener un ingreso adicional para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, asimismo desea en el futuro seguir implementando su negocio con nuevos productos. Este es su crédito número 8 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en prendas de vestir y bisutería.
texts.en: Elvira is 45 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in their own house. She has sold clothing and jewelry for 10 years, offering products to her coworkers. She is a nurse in a hospital in her city. She sells her products on credit, and since she knows the quality of her clients, she isn't worried--she knows that they will be punctual with their payments. She feels satisfied with the work she does, as it allows her to have an additional income to cover her home needs. In the future, she hopes to keep augmenting her business with new products. This is her eight loan from MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support and that they know she is a responsible person with her payments. She is also thankful to be part of their communal bank because all of its members have a lot of solidarity. She is also thankful to the people who will manage the loan she is seeking, since they will help the progress of her business. With this loan, she will invest in merchandise such as clothing and jewelry.

loans.use: Acquire more outfits and jewelry

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es:
Anselmo es un hombre, dedicado al trabajo, de edad ya avanzada, pero con mucho deseo de seguir creciendo en su joyería que logro poner hace varios años.
En donde vende en un mercado prendas de plata. Ha venido evolucionando gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado e invertido más en plata y oro,  logrando pagar sus cuentas.
Ha tenido tiempos difíciles en enfermedad y gastado en sus medicamentos, lo que tiene poco inventario para realizar su trabajo, ya que él hace prenda y compra hecha también.
Con este préstamo invertirá prenda de platas, y prendas de oro, para seguir aumentando las ventas, y lograr mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Anselmo is a man who is dedicated to his work.  Although he is older, he has a strong desire to continue to grow his jewelry business, a business that he started a number of years ago.

He sells silver accessories in a market.  The business has been developing thanks to financings provided by Afodenic, which he has invested in purchases of more silver and gold, so that he could manage to pay his bills.

He has had health problems and expenses for medications which have left him with little inventory for his business, since he both makes and buys the jewelry that he sells.  With this loan, he will invest in gold and silver jewelry so that he can increase his sales and achieve better earnings.

loans.use: he will invest in the purchase of silver and gold so that he can continue to increase his sales and achieve better earnings

loans.name: Patao

texts.en:
Patao S. is 28-years-old, married to Ipanoi Ene Mpakwanik and the father of four school-going children. For the past six years he has been growing wheat on his own piece of land.

Patao learned about KADET from a colleague who was already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan which he will use to purchase and prepare more land and buy chemicals and fertilizer. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to buy animals to fatten and later sell at a profit.

His dream is to buy a bigger piece of land and become a commercial producer. Patao is hard working, and with the right resources at his disposal he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To purchase more land and prepare it for planting and buy chemicals and fertilizer

loans.name: Kodirjon

texts.en:
G. Kodirjon is 30 years old. He is an optimistic and hardworking husband. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent crops. In fact, he draws strength and vitality from his work, which help to make his products the best in the city. Kodirjon has been working in agriculture for more than five years. His loving wife is also involved in the business. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix the house and save enough money for the well-being of his family. He is requesting a loan of 8000 TJS and appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.     

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Wenefreda

texts.en:
Wenefreda F. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Banisilan,  South Cotabato. She is 62 years old. Wenefreda is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Wenefreda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, toothpaste & junk food in the local community. Wenefreda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Wenefreda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wenefreda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Wenefreda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Wenefreda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like beverages

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel  P. O. vive en la cabecera municipal del municipio de Axochiapan, Morelos, México.  Actualmente tiene 23 años, concluyó  un año de nivel medio-superior. Tiene un negocio de venta de antojitos y su crédito lo va ocupar para comprar insumos para su negocio (aceite, manteca, verdura, condimentos, etc.). El se enteró de los préstamos de KIVA y fundación Realidad por medio de un amigo que lo invitó a unirse un grupo. Tiene 5 años con el negocio y ha ido creciendo en número de clientes.  Su esposa es la que elabora la comida y él ayuda despachando a los clientes. Es su primer negocio, lo tiene en su casa y lo  considera muy importante porque se mantienen  del negocio
Siempre le ha gustado atender  a sus clientes   y le da gusto que con su trabajo se mejora su economía, un momento de orgullo para él cuando sus clientes no se quejan y les gusta lo que ellos cocinan. En su establecimiento generalmente atiende a sus vecinos y personas del rumbo, considera que su negocio es popular porque a la gente le gusta la comida, aunque recientemente se han abierto más negocios como el suyo dice que a él no le afecta mucho y que sus ventas son buenas. Las ganancias regularmente las reinvierte en su negocio, tiene como meta construir o rentar un local para establecerse adecuadamente y aumentar sus ventas.
EL señor Israel es casado, su esposa participa en el negocio elaborando la comida, tiene un hijo Jonathan Alexander de 1 año y 4 meses. Nos comenta que le gusta mucho su localidad porque es tranquilo y el clima es muy caluroso y no hace frío. Su negocio es muy importante porque le ayuda a salir adelante económicamente a su familia e ir haciendo algunos detalles de acabado a su vivienda. En lo futuro desea ampliar su negocio y hacerlo un mini restaurante con más servicios que ofrecer y diferentes tipos de comida. Se siente muy contento de recibir el préstamo de KIVA y Fundación Realidad, porque a través de estos apoyos va a poder realizar sus metas, y más que nada construir un patrimonio para su hijo y que no le falte nada. Sus palabras para el equipo de KIVA y Fundación Realidad fueron las siguientes: “muchas gracias me han ayudado mucho (los préstamos)”.
texts.en:
Israel  P. O., 23, lives in the municipal seat of Axochiapan, Morelos, México.  He finished 10th grade.  He has a fast-food business and will use the loan to buy ingredients for the business (oil, lard, vegetables, condiments, etc.)  He found out about KIVA and Fundación Realidad loans though a friend who invited him to join a group.  He has had the business for five years and the number of customers has been steadily growing.  His wife is the one who prepares the food and he helps tending to customers.  This is his first business.  It’s in his house and he considers it to be important because that’s how they support themselves.

He has always enjoyed taking care of his customers and he is happy that his work improves his economy.  A moment of pride for him is when his customers don’t complain and they like what they cook for them.  He usually takes care of neighbors and people from the area in his establishment. He considers that his business is popular because the people like the food. Although recently businesses similar to his have opened he says he hasn’t been affected much and his sales continue to be good.  He regularly reinvests profits into the business.  His goal is to build or rent a locale to set himself up adequately and increase sales.

Israel is married.  His wife participates in the business preparing the food.  He has a son, Jonathan Alexander, who is a year and four months old.  He comments that he likes his location a lot because it’s calm and the weather is warm; it’s not cold.

His business is very important because it helps his family get ahead economically and makes doing some finishing touches to his house possible.  In the future he’d like to expand the business and turn it into a mini restaurant with additional services to offer and different types of food.

He feels very happy to get a KIVA and Fundación Realidad loan because through this assistance he will be able to reach all his goals and, more than anything else, build a patrimony for his son so that he won’t lack anything.

His words for the KIVA and Fundación Realidad teams are the following:  “Thank you very much; the loans have been very helpful.”

loans.use: To buy oil, lard, dishes, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Uugantsetseg

texts.en:
Uugantsetseg is 46 years old and lives with her husband in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in one rented room in a public apartment. Her son lives on his own, separate from his parents, and her husband is disabled. 

She graduated from a trade vocational school as a cashier in 1985. Uugantsetseg operates a construction materials trading business out of a stall at the construction market in the city. She has been engaged in this business since 2007 and has built a stable and successful operation. 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital so as to increase the amount of her products to sell.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
En el municipio de Masaya labora arduamente el señor Juan José L. , quien ya tiene tres años de desempeñarse en el cargo de Fontanero en una empresa ubicada en esta localidad, con el ingreso de su trabajo logra sufragar los gastos que requiere su familia el cual la conforma su esposa y su hijo.

Este señor tiene un gran sueño que es el de ir realizando mejoras en su vivienda para crearle un techo digno a su familia, es por esta razón que ahora visita Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para comprar los materiales de construcción y así dar por cumplido sus anhelos.

Lo que en realidad quiere es que su hijo se desarrolle en su casa con todas las comodidades y tenga un crecimiento sano.
texts.en:
In the town of Masaya, Señor Juan José L. R. works hard. For three years he has worked as a plumber for a business located in this community. With his income, he has been able to pay the costs of the things his family needs. His family consists of his wife and a son.

This man has a great dream, which is to continue completing the improvements in his home to make it a worthy home for his family. It is for this reason that he is now visiting us in our offices at CEPRODEL to apply for a loan to improve his house and thus fulfill his dreams.

What he really wants is for his son to grow up in his home with all the comforts and have a healthy development.

loans.use: Improve his home

loans.name: Melita

texts.en: Melita R. is from the village of Babanuang. She is 39 years old. Melita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Melita runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and drinks and tending a canteen near the school. Melita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2007, Melita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Melita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Melita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Eang S., 44, is married and resides with her family in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for the most populated city in the country. S. sells groceries, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 82 on food and USD 40 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: Thay

texts.en: Thay M. is a 40-year-old married mother who currently lives in the best territory of Siem Reap province. She is a tailor who sews the villagers' clothes in front of her house. She also shares her sewing knowledge with her trainees for a fee. She has a life partner in her husband who works as an internal staff member in a private organization in Oddar Meanchey province. The family has only one kid who is attending school. Thay M. would like a loan of $500 in order to purchase more cloth for providing her clothing service.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for providing her clothing service.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 33-year-old married man with two children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda, with the eight people he takes care of. He is a produce trader, a business in which he has been involved for ten years, having begun with 600,000 UGX that he had saved. He now boasts of a capital of 6,000,000 UGX. John wants to educate his children and build a permanent house. He is requesting a loan to buy maize produce for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Fuentes Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la señora Graciela B. una integrante del grupo "FUENTES", que esta ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz en México. Se ve al grupo de señoras al rededor de Graciela en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa que inicio hace 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar mas mercancia de temporada y así ofrecerles más variedad a sus clientas para todos los gustos y tallas. Sus compañeras y vecinos la conocen por ser persona responsable, trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente satisfecha ya que podra incrementar sus ventas y tener mas clientes lo que le permitira incrementar sus ganancias y poder de manera apoyar a su familia. Tiene 24 años, estudio la carrera tecnica en enfermeria, es casada y tiene en total 3 hijos. Quiere este prestamo para comprar ropa de temporada. Tambien espera más adelante poder realizar unos arreglos a su casa y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan un mejor futuro y logren sus sueños y así nunca les haga falta nada.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Mrs. Graciela B.’s house.  She is one of the members of the “FUENTES” (Fountains) group located in the State of Veracruz, México.  The group of women can be seen surrounding Graciela in the photo.

She started selling clothes five years ago.  She is asking for the loan to buy more seasonal merchandise in assorted styles and sizes to have more variety available to offer her customers. 

Her fellow group members and neighbors know her for being a responsible, hard working woman who is devoted to her family.  She feels very satisfied with the loan because she’ll be able to increase sales and have more customers which will make it possible for her to increase profits thus supporting her family.

She is 24 years old and studied Technical Nursing.  She’s married and has a total of three children.  She wants this loan to buy seasonal clothes.  She also hopes later on to get ahead on home improvements and to continue supporting her children’s schooling so that they will have a better future, will see their dreams come true and so that they will never lack anything.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Mrs. Yan, 58, is a domestic farmer who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. To make a daily income, she always grows various crops on her own farmland. She is married to Mr. Chhan, 58, who works in the crop-planting business also. They earn about $3 each day to pay for the expenses in their family. For instance utilities expense, food expenses, and education expenses etc. Because this is the rainy season and Mrs. Yan doesn’t have money to plant her crops yet, she decided to ask for a loan in order to pay for plowing costs, fertilizers, insecticides, seeds, and the land she bought earlier. Mrs. Yan is pictured with her husband inside their house.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs, fertilizers, insecticides, seeds, and previous land costs.

loans.name: Ononbayar

texts.en:
Ononbayar is 30 years old and lives with his wife, mother and brother in Mongolia’s capital, Ulaanbaatar. The family lives in a small house, in the outer ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) districts of the city. His mother stays at home while his wife works at The Center Library. Ononbayar’s brother works with a local government organization. 
Ononbayar helps support his family by operating a hollow-block, small business. When he started in 2010 he was using hollow-block machines bought on a leasing contract from the bank. He repaid the leasing contract over 6 months. Before his hollow block business, he sold firewood and coal at a local outdoor market. Now he sells firewood and coal in winter and, in the other seasons, he manufactures hollow-blocks. With a loan of 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT), he will purchase cement, pebbles and other materials to make hollow-blocks. 
Ononbayar wants to expand his business and to buy a block paving machine because there is high demand for block paving.

loans.use: to purchase cement, pebbles and other materials to make hollow blocks

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie, 53 years old,  is married with 5 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Annie has operated a food vending business in the Philippines for 22 years. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Annie would like to save enough money to afford to send her child to school.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 37 años reside en la comunidad de Alto Yapaz (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Angélica, su esposa desde hace 16 años. Ambos tienen una hija, Joyce, a la que cuidan con mucho cariño en su casa propia. Como hombre trabajador y responsable; Luis dedica su tiempo y esfuerzo en la agricultura, donde hace 6 años comenzó a trabajar las 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que le fueron heredadas a su esposa. Ahí comenzó la siembra de plátano, ahora ya tiene café entre sus cultivos, intensificando así su producción. Además de recibir la capacitación de la cooperativa de la zona, donde vende el grano maduro de café. Produciendo así un café de mayor calidad cada año. Pero la actividad que le genera ganancias constantes, es la compra y venta de plátanos y frutas de temporada a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde viaja constantemente. Después de acopiar la fruta a los agricultores de la zona se dirige al mercado mayorista de la ciudad donde vende también su propia producción; obteniendo así mayores ganancias. Ahora el está pensando juntar mayor capital de trabajo con lo que pueda comprar más terrenos de cultivo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para que cumplir con sus objetivos. Luis de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios kilos de plátanos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis, age 37, lives in the Alto Yapaz (central Peruvian jungle) community.  This is where he established his family with his wife of 16 years, Angélica.  They have a daughter, Joyce.  They take care of her with a lot of affection in their own house.

As a hard-working and responsible man, Luis devotes his time and effort to faming.  Six months ago he started to work the two hectares of farming land that his wife inherited.  He started by planting bananas.  Now he already has coffee amongst his crops, which is augmenting his production.  He also receives training from the cooperative in the area where he sells the mature coffee beans.  He thereby produces a better quality of coffee every year.

However, the business activity that generates steady income is buying and selling bananas and seasonal fruit.  He does this in the city of Huancayo, where he constantly travels.  After getting together the fruit from the farmers in the area, he heads to the wholesale market in the city.  That is where he also sells his own production.  That way he gets greater income.

He is now planning on getting together more working capital to buy more land to cultivate.  He belongs to the El Palomar al Éxito Communal Bank.  This is his first loan with MFP, where he hopes for their support in order to achieve his objectives.  Once he gets your support he will use the requested money to buy several kilos of bananas for his business.

loans.use: to buy several kilos of bananas.

loans.name: Wella

texts.en:
Wella is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Wella has a shop selling canned goods, biscuits, detergents & noodles. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, detergents & beverages.

Wella has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Wella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents & beverages

loans.name: Jean Batiste

texts.en:
Jean Batiste is a 23-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur. He is not married and for the past six years has been running a general store selling sugar, cooking oil, rice, and other goods.  

His business is going well, and he requires a loan so that he can purchase more goods that will allow him to continue to expand his business and grow his profits.

His goal in the future is to generate enough income so that he can begin construction of a house

loans.use: to buy goods such as cooking oil, rice, etc.

loans.name: Kidiri

texts.en:
Kidiri is 62 years old.  He is married to Naleku, and they have two children aged between sixteen and fourteen years.  He has been operating a livestock business for the past twenty-one years, making a monthly profit of KES.14,430.  He is borrowing KES.80,000, with which he plans to purchase more livestock (4 cows) for sale.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to establish a dairy farm and beef farm.  In the future, he hopes to have a big dairy farm and be selling milk to Kenya Creameries Company and Kenya Meat Commission.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock (4 cows) for sale.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia is a 29-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and two school-aged children. In 2009, she started working as a private teacher receiving students at her home. She cooperates with her husband financially to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to prepare a special education room and equip it with the needed tools, tables, education wall etc. She is hoping to receive more students in the coming school season.

loans.use: to prepare a special education room and equip it with tools, tables, education wall etc

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta D. 66 años D. edad, resiD. en casa propia en zona muy humilD. del país, con sus dos queridos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Ella se dedica al comercio D. diferentes productos D. manera ambulante como: verduras, frutas, pollos, pescado, etc. Marta es una mujer ejemplar la cual no se cansa D. trabajar a pesar D. su avanzada edad. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y esta es  la que la impulsa a seguir luchando y trabajando para poder darles el pan D. cada día, va vendiendo por las calles principales y colonias cercanas a donD. resiD.. Y ahora ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el fin D. surtir su negocio D. tal manera que los clientes siempre que le soliciten algo, ella cuente con ello y queden satisfechos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra D.: verduras, frutas, pollos, pescado, etc. ya que estos son los productos que ella ofrece en su pequeño negocio. Espera que con esta decisión pueda lograr lo que desea y poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Marta is 66 years old. She lives in her own house in a very humble area of the country with her two beloved children, who are students. She sells many different products door-to-door, such as: vegetables, fruits, chickens, fish, etc. Marta is an exemplary woman who does not tire of working in spite of her advanced age. For her, the most important thing is her family, and this is what pushes her to keep fighting and working in order to proviD. them with their daily needs. She goes out selling on the main streets and in neighborhoods near where she lives. Now she has decided to ask INTEGRAL for this loan with the goal of stocking her business in such a way so that whenever her customers ask her for something, she will have it, and they will be satisfied. She will invest the loan in the purchase of: vegetables, fruits, chickens, fish, etc., since those are the products she offers in her small business. She hopes that with this decision she will be able to achieve what she wants and will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruit, chickens, fish, etc.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lillian is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental fees. 

For the past year, she has operated a beauty salon business, operating in a shop with her customers being her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also operates a coconut selling business through which she earns her other source of livelihood. Lillian dreams of becoming a leading supplier of charcoal and establishing a dressmaking school in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase stock for her cosmetic shop, hair relaxer, hair extensions and six sacks of charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her cosmetic shop, hair relaxer, hair extensions and six sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es: Milagro del Carmen vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos menores hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad como granos básicos, huevos, carnes, lacteos, productos enlatados, entre otros más, su negocio es muy conocido en la localidad pues Milagro siempre tiene lo que el cliente necesita con excelente calidad de productos y a muy buenos precios; su tienda es la más surtida del lugar, además les dá el mejor servicio siempre recibe a las personas con una gran sonrisa en el rostro esperando poder atenderlos de la mejor manera; Milagro piensa que dentro de las personas esta la capacidad de manifestar los sueños, y ella quiere manifestar y cumplir sus sueños de ver crecer el negocio, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos con los que no cuenta y demandan sus clientes, como: medicina, cosméticos, bebidas dulces, productos instantáneos, jabón, entre otros. De esta forma Milagro del Carmen espera no decir "no hay" en su negocio y vender todo lo posible para conservar sus clientes y obtener mayores ganancias que siempre den el sustento diario a su familia para al final mejorar la calidad de sus vidas
texts.en:
Milagro del Carmen lives with her common-law husband and their two minor children in their own house.  She runs a store where she sells daily consumption items such as staples, eggs, meat, dairy products, canned goods and others.  Her business is well-known in the town because Milagro stocks everything a customer could ever need in the way of excellent products at good prices.  Her store has the best inventory around and she gives the best customer service, always greeting people with a big smile on her face and wanting to help in any way she can.

Milagro believes that each person has the capacity to manifest his or her dreams.  Her dream is to grow her business, so she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL which she will use to buy products in most demand by her customers, such as: medicine, cosmetics, sweet drinks, instant products, and soap, among other items.  Milagro del Carmen hopes that she will not have to say "I'm out of that." at her store because she wants to do everything she can to keep her customers and obtainer higher earnings so she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy sweets, bread, beverages, instant products, and soap.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a farmer and a father of three. Two of his children are adults and the youngest is nine years old and schooling. He has been in farming for 10 years in his hometown of Murang’a, in Central Kenya producing milk and selling to the local market.

Simon has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the loan to buy an additional dairy cow and hopes his milk production will improve his family's livelihood. He wants to own four dairy cows in the future.

Simon laments of the escalating cost of animal feed.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri is 62 years old and lives with his wife and children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. 

His wife helps with his business. His elder son is an entrepreneur and the younger one is a clerk at the grocery shop. 

Batsuuri operates a water sales business. He started his business in 2006 by delivering water by his carriage. Now he owns a pick-up truck and has many regular customers such as cafes, kindergartens and schools. 

He is a hard-working and diligent man who says, "I started my business from a scratch. I am very confident that my business will expand."

He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to repair his pick-up truck.

loans.use: To repair his pick-up truck.

loans.name: Isaac Aura

texts.en: Isaac is a 50-year-old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 20 years to 28 years. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, beverages, detergents etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a shopping centre and his primary customers are the local people. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 70,000 loan to increase his stock of items. His business goal is to grow into wholesale within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en: Bilqees earns a living by selling blankets and is applying for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to buy more of them to sell to her customers. Her goal is to increase her income and her profits. Her husband works for the government and her two sons are also employed. Bilqees is 59 years old but is still very active and performs her household duties very efficiently. She has been in her line of work for many years and is confident that this loan will help her improve her business and provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sonny

texts.en: Sonny is 35 years old. He is married and has one child. He has been involved in the farm business for 10 years. He has one and a half hectares of land, where he grows corn. He sells his harvest to traders and earned about 35,000 PHP from his last crop. The income from it will then help him to cope with the needs of his family and give his child a higher education. Thus, Sonny wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and corn seedlings. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further growth his business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and corn seedlings

loans.name: Ramathan

texts.en:
Ramathan is 32 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Ramathan has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells home products like food, cooking oil, and soap. 

To help expand his business, Ramathan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cooking oil and soap for resale, and will help Ramathan to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Ramathan hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Ramathan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ramathan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil and soap for resale.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 39-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married, living with her husband and two children. She cooperates with her husband who has been working as a soldier in the Lebanese army and he’s now benefiting from his retirement compensation.  

As for Hiyam, she has been teaching private lessons from her home for the past 10 years. Today, she’s asking for a loan of 1,100 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a library for her education room. She notes that this will help her arrange her books in a proper way. In the future, she plans to open her own learning center.

loans.use: to purchase a library for her education room

loans.name: Sreylak

texts.en:
Sreylak (pictured above), age 18, is single. She lives with her sister and father on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Sreylak is a chef. She cooks for a restaurant in Phnom Penh. She is applying for her first loan in the mount of $1,200 to repair her home by constructing new walls and replacing the wooden stilts of her house.

loans.use: to repair her home by constructing new walls and replacing the wooden stilts of her house.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her late sister's children). Fatuma has operated a beauty salon business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. She sells her products in a retail shop.

Fatuma has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. The main business challenges for Fatuma include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a bridal salon and to build her own house. Fatuma lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids

loans.name: Paris Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Ileana quien tiene un taller de costura en su casa desde hace 2 años, inicio con una pequeña pulpería y le fue mejor como costurera que cambio actividad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como conos de hilos, gruesas de botones, adornos, encajes, telas, entre telas etc. Vilgen tiene una venta de fritanga en su casa y Yahosca tiene una pulpería en su casa también.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising members. One of them is Ileana; she has a sewing workshop in her home, a business that she started 2 years ago. She began with a small grocery store but has done better in her shop and decided to focus on the sewing business. The loan will be used to buy raw materials like thread spools, different types of buttons, decorations, lace, fabrics, backing fabric, etc. Vilgen sells fried fast-food in her home and Yahosca has a small grocery store in her home.

loans.use: buy raw materials like thread spools, different types of buttons, decorations, lace, fabrics, backing fabric, etc.

loans.name: Ichelowo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ICHELOWO est composé de dix neuf personnes qui sont qui résident dans le même village. Jeanne, la représentante du groupe, est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeanne est âgée de 30 ans. Jeanne n’a pas fréquenté l’école et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Firmin. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et aucun à leur charge. Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Jeanne et son mari. Pour ce faire, Jeanne vend du riz, de l’huile végétale et du gari (farine de manioc) à son domicile depuis douze ans. Jeanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’accroître leur activité, Jeanne et les autres membres du groupe ICHELOWO sollicitent pour la deuxième fois un financement auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group ICHELOWO is composed of 19 persons, who reside in the same village. Jeanne, the group’s representative, is the one with a hand raised in the photo. She is 30 years old and married to a mason by the name of Firmin. The couple have two children, of whom one is in school, and none is in their care. Jeanne lives together with her husband and children. 

The diverse family expenses are covered by the Jeanne and her husband. To do so, she has been selling rice, vegetable oil, and “gari” (cassava flour) out of her home for twelve years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of increasing her business, Jeanne and he other members of the group ICHELOWO are requesting for a second time financing from ALIDé. The first loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase rice, vegetable oil, and some gari (cassava flour)

loans.name: Jeluwaida

texts.en: Jeluwaida is a 25-year-old teacher in a primary school in Tanzania. She is an open-minded person with an entrepreneurial spirit. Jeluwaida wants to start a business in agriculture and wants her students to also develop interest in entrepreneurship. As first step, she decided to invest in a solar home system because her small house was not connected to the public power grid. Therefore, Jeluwaida had to prepare her classes before it got dark which didn't leave her time for getting enrolled in her agricultural business. With a solar system in her house she is now more flexible in her time schedule and has improved her daily living situation. Furthermore, she can start with her business in agriculture which gives her a second income that she can use to pay her sister's college fee.

loans.use: to get energy supply via solar system

loans.name: Abieyuwa

texts.en: Mrs. Abieyuwa U. is a delighted LAPO member, who is happy to be in LAPO family.  She designs and makes clothes for people in her community. She is 38 years old, married with 3 children. She is eager to expand her business and requests a loan of the above amount.

loans.use: To improve her fashion home

loans.name: Wangaeli

texts.en:
S. is married with four children. He lives in the Kiwalani area in Dar es Salaam. He owns a shop near his residence. The shop provides him with the income to raise the family. He sells different items in his shop, like detergents, sugar, salt, soap, coffee, tea and cold drinks.

He recently realized high demand for sewing and tailoring supplies. With his savings, he managed to stock a few of these sewing materials. He cannot meet the demand for these items due to insufficient working capital. He is in need of additional capital of USD 1000 to run this new line of business effectively and add to his stock of existing items.

loans.use: To add a new line of business

loans.name: Amir

texts.ru:
R. Amir, married with 2 children, wife is taking care of the house, kids are at school. Have been in this business for 7 years. Started with selling small batches of shoes. Has significantly increased the turnaround during the years of working with Microinvest. He is obtaining and delivering his products by himself. Amir is requesting $1,200 to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Alex Oganezov, Kiva Volunteer.

Раупов Амир женат, имеет 2 детей. Его жена домохозяйка, дети учатся в школе. Бизнесом занимается 7 лет. Начинал свой бизнес с мелкорозничной торговли обуви. За годы работы с Микроинвест Раупов Амир на много увеличил свой товарооборот. За товаром ездит сам. Раупов Амир запрашивает 1200$ для расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use:
Business expansion

расширения бизнеса

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
"I am Tahira N. and I live in Lahore, a metropolis of Pakistan. I have two daughters and two sons. My sons play different musical instruments at parties and my daughters stay home with me. I want to educate them but because of my small income, I am unable to do so. My husband is a Rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle) driver, which we purchased on installments. The Rickshaw is becoming old now and requires some repairing. The loan we will get for the Rickshaw will enable us to repair the Rickshaw and we would be able to run it for more days in a month."

Tahira N., Pakistan

loans.use: For the maintenance of Rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle)

loans.name: Selesitina

texts.en: Selesitina is a 37 year old lady, married, and has four children. She is a very diligent in her family and community commitments, and is well-known for her community fundraising efforts. Her plantation is her biggest source of income and she works really hard at it. Her first loan was used to buy some chemicals and fertilizers for her plantation and cement, timber, and iron roofs for  home improvement. She hopes that her next loan will be used to add to her vegetable garden business to back up her existing plantation. She is very happy and appreciates SPBD’s loan program. She hopes to keep taking future loans for a long time to come.

loans.use: For home improvement

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita dedicates herself to the sale of toasted bread, natural juices and sandwiches, a business which she started more than four years ago. Mercedita is 37 years old and has three children (two boys and a girl). Her husband works in a construction company. She gets raw materials in her town and doesn’t buy fruits since her husband has a field and cultivates various types of fruits.

Mercedita’s dream is to have a cafeteria. She plans to remodel a room of her house to convert it into the cafeteria. She had put aside money to invest in the remodel and will sell a cow she has in order to have money to finish off the work. She needs funds to help her cover the costs that the work requires. Once her locale is ready, Mercedes will see her business change radically. She will more easily sell off the food and she will get more clients, so she will significantly increase her income and will better support her family.

loans.use: Invest to remodel a room of her house in order to run her small cafeteria.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Mrs. Maricela lives in the Juanjui district of Mariscal Cáceres, San Martín. She dedicates herself to selling kebabs and all other types of grilled meat products. Her business is based out of her home. She decided to enter into a business with the intention of supporting her husband with the household expenses, but she didn’t have enough money to get started. Thanks to an invitation she received, she joined the communal bank “San Martín de Porres,” in which Manuela Ramos loaned her the money she needed to get her business started. With this loan for $525, which she will pay in four months, she will buy stock for her everyday sales, including chicken, beef, pork, several kilos of giblets, and more.

Currently she is working with her husband, who devotes himself to selling plantains in bulk to guaranteed customers in various markets in the area. They take on this business in the morning, and in the afternoon they devote themselves to selling grilled meats.

Mrs. Maricela is 36 years old and lives with her husband, who is her rock, and together they fight to get their children ahead in life. Among her plans are the refurbishment of a location hear their home where they can expand and improve their meat sales, and so bring better services to the customers who always come see them.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maricela vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de anticuchos, juanes, tacacho y todo lo relacionado a la venta de parrillas. Su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio. Decidió incursionar en un negocio con la intención de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, pero no contaba con el capital necesario para iniciarlo, es así que gracias a una invitación que recibió decidió ingresar al Banco Comunal “San Martín de Porres”, en el que Manuela Ramos le prestó el capital necesario para poner en marcha el negocio. Con el préstamo de S/.1,500.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará los insumos para su venta de todos los días como carne de pollo, res y cerdo, menudencias en kilos y otros. Actualmente está trabajando con su esposo quien se dedica a la venta de plátanos en grandes cantidades los que son vendidos en los mercados de la zona donde ya tienen clientes asegurados. Este negocio lo realizan por la mañana y por las tardes se dedica a la venta de sus asados en parrilla. La señora Maricela tiene 36 años y vive con su esposo, quien es su punto de apoyo y con quien lucha por sacar adelante a sus tres hijos. Dentro de sus planes está el acondicionar un local dentro de su casa para ampliar y ubicar mejor sus venta de parrillas y brindar así un mejor servicio a sus clientes quienes siempre la visitan.

loans.use: Purchase of sales stock - beef, chicken, pork.

loans.name: Yolanda's Group

texts.en:
Luz, Yolanda and Herminia have belonged to the community bank Desarrollo for 3, 5, and 3 years respectively.

Luz is 38 years old, she is married and has two children. Luz sells food staples such as flour, rice and oil from her mother's house. When she started with the community bank she only sold a few products, but now her store is well stocked.

Yolanda is also married and has five children. She is 38 years old. Yolanda has been selling vegetables from a stand, which she owns, since she was very young. Furthermore, Yolanda and her husband have a motorcycle taxi that brings in additional income. Previously, Yolanda sold food staples from her mother’s house and is now thinking of re-opening this business.

Herminia is 54 years old. She is a widow and has ten children. Herminia sells typical breads such as chapla, which is similar to pita bread. She sells her bread near the bus station in Ayacucho. Sometimes Herminia rents an oven and makes her bread. Other times she buys bread to re-sell later.

Luz, Yolanda and Herminia need loans of 1200, 1000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, sugar, beans, milk, bear, soft drinks, spinach, parsley, cilantro, flour, butter, and anis.

As part of the community bank they have learned to be responsible, punctual, to have high self-esteem, and to save. Luz, Yolanda, and Herminia will use their savings to put a roof on their house and pay for anything unexpected. Their dreams are to continue developing their business, open a grocery store in their house, buy a car, and give a good education to their children.

loans.use: Luz, Yolanda and Herminia need loans of 1200, 1000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, sugar, beans, milk, bear, soft drinks, spinach, parsley, cilantro, flour, butter, and anis.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma is a 40-year-old father of 3, and a resident of Tandika. He has various businesses including sales of radios, TVs, and other electronics. He also owns a shop selling traditional medicine in the Tandika area, which his wife is taking care of. He gets the medicine from traditional healers, and he gets prescriptions from Zanzibar and Tabora. He is in need of USD $600 to help him expand his business.

loans.use: Expand his business of natural medicines

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Mrs. Adela V. L. is a member of the Community Bank “Sarita Colonia”. She lives in the San Martín region, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres and the district of Juanjui. She sells groceries, vegetables, candy, sewing notions and accessories and soft drinks in a store located in her home, where the neighbourhood's inhabitants do their daily shopping.

She decided to start her business with the support of her husband. She wanted to generate her own income and raise the family's economic level so that her children would be able to stay in school.

With this loan of 1500 soles (Peruvian currency) , which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy convenience products such as sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of milk, oil, canned food, packages of noodles, detergents and toilet paper among other items, in order to sell them wholesale and retail to her clients.

She is 52 years old with 3 children who still depend on her. They support her in the house and in the business. Her goal for the future is to increase her sales and launch a second business: wholesale soft drink sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Adela V. L. es socia del Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, verduras, pasamanería, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas, ubicado en su propia casa del Jr. La Merced cuadra 5. donde acuden diariamente a comprar los moradores del barrio.

Decidió iniciar su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo con la finalidad de manejar sus propios ingresos y aumentar su nivel económico, para poder ayudar a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprara productos de primera necesidad como sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, aceite, conservas, paquetes de fideos, detergentes y papel higiénico entre otros, para poder venderlos al por mayor y menor a sus clientes.

Tiene 52 años y 3 hijos que todavía dependen de ella quienes la apoyan en la casa y en el negocio, su meta en el futuro es ampliar sus ventas y poner otro negocio de bebidas gaseosas al por mayor.

loans.use: She'll use the loan to buy more products for her business.

loans.name: Huru

texts.en: Huru A. is an Internally Displaced Person and she had been working as a hairdresser in Aghdam where she came from. Now she rents a small place close to her house. She believes that she can turn this place into the best beauty salon in the neighborhood in the close future. She needs this loan to change the lights and add some equipment, because she presently has only scissors, combs, and a hair dryer. Huru is married and has two children. Her husband is a bus driver.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment to upgrade her little business

loans.name: Sivai

texts.en:
Sivai T., 54, is married and has eight children. She has been in the business of selling taro products for the last four years. She sells to the general public and to people in her village two days per week. Her husband and children help her out with her business.

Sivai has had five prior loans from SPBD, and expects to earn a weekly net cash flow of $166. SPBD loans are Sivai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She will use part of her loan to increase her earnings by building a copra dryer, which people in this part of the world use to process coconuts.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her plantation and materials to build a copra dryer.

loans.name: Zelmira

texts.es:
Zelmira owns a motor taxi and runs her own transportation business. She also sells general grocery items in a tourist location near Lake Yarinacocha. She has two young children. She would like to expand her business and make necessary repairs to her motor taxi. She is requesting a loan and with your support she will be able to achieve her goals.

Zelmira, se dedica a la administración de un mototaxi, debido a que es propietaria de una de estas herramientas de transporte, además de dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes en Tushmo (lugar turístico perteneciente al Lago Yarinacocha), tiene dos hijos menores.Tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su espacio de labor y de reparar los desperfectos de su herramienta de movilidad y por esa razón solicita la ayuda de tu bondadoso y noble corazón.

loans.use: TO MAKE REPAIRS TO HER MOTOR TAXI AND CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji is the wife of U. and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children and runs a thread-making business. Her husband runs a power loom. She is applying for a loan to buy another power loom for her husband.

She is making this loan with four other people. Kosar baji wants a loan for her own power loom business. Naseem baji wants a loan for her business selling utensils. Farhat baji wants a loan to buy land. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy more supplies for her carpet-making business.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Abdoulaye N. is a merchant by trade with five years experience. He is single and lives in the Randoulène Sud quarter. With Ramadan approaching, he is requesting this loan so he can increase his amount of stock.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

abdoulaye N. est un commerçant de profession qui a une expérience de cinq ans dans ce secteur d'activité .il est célibataire et vit au quartier randoulène sud. avec l'approche du ramadan ,il sollicite ce pret dans le but de renforcer ses stocks.

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Leilah

texts.en:
Leilah M., age 49, is a widow with 7 children. She currently has 2 businesses: a shop where she sells food and other household items, and she owns a dalla-dalla (a public bus). She started these businesses in 2007 and 2005, respectively. Before starting these businesses, Leilah was a housewife and took care of her children. Her shop is open daily from 6:00 AM to 10:00 PM, and she is able to earn a monthly profit of about $130, while she earns about $261 per month from the dalla-dalla.

Leilah has previously taken 4 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used these loans to start her small shop and to later increase the stock in the shop. Now that she has paid back these loans successfully, she is hoping to receive another loan to continue to increase the supplies in her shop.

loans.use: To increase stock in her general store

loans.name: Aïssa

texts.fr:
Madame Aïssa G. est âgée de 33 ans et vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son mari et ses 2 enfants dans le quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Malgré ses obligations professionnelles (Professeur de son état) elle mène parallèlement des activités génératrices de revenu. Son apprentissage s’est effectué auprès de sa mère une grande commerçante très connue au niveau de la ville de Ségou. Ainsi elle a su concilier ses activités professionnelles et ses activités commerciales à savoir l’achat vente du charbon de bois, et du bois de chauffe.
En relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans, elle a bénéficié de 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et un prêt individuel tous correctement remboursés. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser ce nouveau pour acheter, 200 sacs de charbon et 1 chargement de camion en bois de chauffe. 
Elle s’approvisionne généralement dans les villages environnants (tel Bananida dans la préfecture de Konobougou) et quelques fois sur place à Ségou, auprès des paysans officiellement reconnus dans la profession.
Madame Aïssa G. vend à domicile au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée de ménagères et de boulangers (qui sont ravitaillés sur commande et. servis à leurs lieux de travail). 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA, qui lui permettra de supporter les charges familiales et d’augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Aïssa G. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a traditional family in the Bagadadji neighborhood of the town of Ségou (Fourth Administrative Region, Mali). In addition to her regular job as a government-employed teacher, Aïssa engages in some income-generating activities. She learnt her craft from her mother, an excellent business woman, well-known throughout Ségou. Aïssa has managed to reconcile her professional endeavors with her commercial activities, the buying and selling of charcoal and firewood. In the past four years of her business relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, Aïssa has been the recipient of four group loans and one individual loan, all duly repaid. This would be her second individual loan, and she intends to use it to purchase 200 bags of charcoal and one truckload of firewood. Normally, she buys her merchandise from recognized professionals, rural people in surrounding villages (Bananida, Konobougou for example), and sometimes in Ségou itself. Aïssa G. sells out of her home, on a cash or credit basis, to a clientele consisting of housewives and bakers. She takes orders and delivers to their place of work. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of $83 (40,000 West African frances), which would enable her to discharge her family responsibilities and to put money back into the business.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Palmira João Da Costa

texts.pt:
Palmira Joao da costa M. é natural de Macaneta   distrito de Boane província do Maputo, tem 49 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de dois filhos gémeos com 15 anos de idade que estudam. Para alem dos filhos sustenta 4 sobrinhos que vive com eles.

Palmira estudou até 6ªclasse e deixou por falta de condições para continuar dado que na sua zona o ensino ia até esta classe e os pais não tinham condições para pagar o internamento fora do distrito. Desde a sua infância nunca mudou se para outra zona.vive na casa propria

Palmira é negociante onde vende vários produtos ente Amendoim, feiao, Açúcar, óleos, etec. Tem um rendimento diário 1500,00mt, este é o Quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, conheceu a hluvuku a traves do trabalho de divulgação que os promotores da Hluvuku fizeram no mercado.

Palmira está confiante que pagara antes do tempo dado que tem um projecto na vista de construir dependências para aluguer no seu quintal e conta com o credito.
texts.en:
Palmira Joao da Costa M. was born in Macaneta in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo. She is 49 years old, divorced, and mother of twin sons who are 15 years old and in school. Besides her children, she supports 4 nieces and nephews who live with her. Palmira studied until the 6th grade and then stopped because she lacked the conditions to continue. The education in her zone only went up to 6th grade, and her parents weren’t able to send her to boarding school outside the district. Since her childhood, Palmira has never lived in another zone. She lives in her own house. Palmira is a businesswoman and sells a variety of products ranging from peanuts, beans, sugar, oil, etc. She has a daily income of 1500 MT. This is Palmira’s fourth loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. She found out about Hluvuku through advertising done by Hluvuku promoters at the market. Palmira is confident she can pay before the estimated time because she has a project of building rooms for rent in her yard. She is counting on the credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling basic goods

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience A. is 41 years old, married, and has four children. Currently all the kids are in school. Patience has been a dealer and seller of timber products like plywood for the past twelve years. Selling plywood has been her major occupation and the main source of livelihood for her family. She owns a timber products shop where customers come to purchase wood.

She requests a loan to purchase additional wood like plywood and others to expand her operation. This she believes will increase her savings and help pay for her children's education costs. She belongs to the community group called “Macedonia” Trust Group. In this group, members serve as guarantees for one another to access and repay loans. Patience does not work on her meeting days.

loans.use: Buy additional wood for building

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa B., mariée, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 7 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter des tissus et des fournitures pour faire des ensembles en tissus teintés, wax et bazin et vendre. Les revenus tirés de son commerce vont lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Awa B. is married and has three children to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group of Peyrissac for seven and a half years. Her work consists in buying cloth and supplies to make suits out of dyed fabrics, 'wax' cloth, and damask to sell. The income derived from her commerce is going to allow her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and supplies to make suits to sell

loans.name: Gairatmurod

texts.ru: Джурабоев Гайратмурод житель Гиссарского района.Возраст 32 года . Женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет высшее образование , работает директором в средней школе района. Кроме того  имеет дополнительный доход. Занимается торговлей крупно рогатого скота. Опыт в данном бизнесе составляет 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит сроком на 6 месяцев. А использовать его для того, чтобы купить бычка.
texts.en:
Gairatmurod D. lives in the Gissar region. He is 32 years old, married with 4 children. He has a university education and is a director of a junior high school in Gissar. He supplements his income by selling livestock. He has been doing this for 10 years. He wants to use the loan to buy a young bull and plans to repay it within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a young bull

loans.name: Cheab

texts.en:
Cheab S. is 29 years old and lives at home,in Prey Veng province, with her husband and two young children. She is a good housewife, doing housework and cooking for her family members. Her husband, who pictured here with his wife and two children, is a construction foreman. He has been doing construction since 1998 and is able to make about US$ 15 every day.

Mrs. Cheab S. would like to take out a loan to purchase construction tools for her husband. In the future, she wants to open a grocery store to earn additional income to help raise their standard of living.

loans.use: Construction tools for her husband

loans.name: Porch

texts.en: Mrs. Porch B. lives in Srae Boeung village in Takeo Province. She is a rice middleman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to resell and to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Yin Sovann, is a hard-working man. Mrs. Porch B. is 26 years old and the mother of a young child. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El señor Benito Ramos M. vive en casa propia, en la zona  8 de Diciembre, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, viviendo solo ya que tuvo que separarse de su esposa y actualmente mantiene a sus tres hijos.
El señor Benito trabaja como albañil, realizando construcciones para personas particulares.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una nueva habitación ya que sus hijos están creciendo y se ve en la necesidad de proporcionarles un espacio para su desenvolvimiento.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Benito Ramos M. lives in his own home, in the zone called 8th of December, on the west side of the city La Paz. He lives alone now that he has separated from his wife, and he currently supports his three sons. Señor Benito works as a bricklayer, completing construction projects for individual people. The loan that he is asking for is for the construction of a new house now that his sons are raised and he sees the need to give them space that his is not involved with. This is the fifth time that he has asked for a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis shows that he is well qualified and able to accept a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a new house for Benito's sons

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan P. is proud to be a rice grower. She has been a farmer since she got married to her childhood friend, Cesar Pamplano. She is 47 years old and has five children. At first, she wanted only a simple life for her family but now she thinks for her children's future. She wants to work hard to send all her children to school. Someday, her children will become professionals in their own fields and will have better careers to support their future families well.

She is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers to improve her farm. The loan will help her achieve better yield. Aside from that, she will also use the loan to buy pesticides to protect her rice.

CEVI is reaching out farmers to sustain and grow their livelihood. CEVI gives their clients credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Trea

texts.en:
Mr. Trea K. lives in Kdey Thnaut village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. In his plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer and gasoline to pump water to support the field during the dry season. Additionally, he wants to use the rest of the loan money to hire laborers to work on the field.

His wife, Mrs. Un Mut, is a dessert seller. Mr. Trea K. is 53 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is employed in a casino. He and his wife are both in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline to pump water and pay laborers

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva U., 45, is married and lives at Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has three children. Since she had skills and experienced in manicure/pedicure it was a way for her to earn a living.

Oliva joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in October 2006 to avail its loan facilities and benefits. She really wanted to help her husband who is a motor cab driver. She applies for php5,000 to buy variety of colors of nail polish. Through this economic activity, she will be able to address the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: Buy nail polish.

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, Uguloy started her business of selling the national women's dresses. Experienced and talented in the business, Uguloy has expanded her business into a successful trade, supporting her family of two children. Throughout the last year, IMON International has provided assistance to Uguloy’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Uguloy has used her previous loans wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 3600 Somoni to replace the depleted inventory, hoping to continue expanding her business and supporting her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy inventory for dress shop

loans.name: Renalwa

texts.en:
Renalwa M. is from Baclayon, Bohol. Her business is a sari-sari (variety) store. Her age is 59. And the year she started a business is 2004. She has been selling various types of goods to earn a living for her family. Like any other businessperson, she has been aiming for success in her business to save for her grandchildren. 

The loan she seeks from CEVI, a Kiva partner, is for Php 4,000. She will buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store. She thinks that by doing so, she will be able to attract more customers.

She has been blessed that she joined the CEVI program. She receives not only loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara cultivates vegetables on her farm and then sells them to people within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more vegetable seedlings and fertilizer. She is 43 years old and married with two children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
En 2008 cette femme a commencé le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, sa manière d’accueillir ses clients fait que beaucoup de personne préfère acheter chez elle. Son stock a connu une baisse, pour cela elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter divers produits d’alimentation générale pour se réapprovisionner.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2008, this woman started a grocery business. Many people prefer to buy from her because of the way she accommodates her customers. Her inventory has experience a drop. And so she is requesting a loan to buy various grocery items in order to stock up again. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Sam Art

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Art N. is villager in Trapaing Chhouk village in Takeo province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Yorng Kimly, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He now wants to help his wife’s business by expanding it. Now Mrs. Sam Art N. decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to buy a motorbike to transport the vegetables to sell at the market. This couple has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add her saving to buy a motorbike to transport the vegetables to sell at the market.

loans.name: Better World #1 Group

texts.en:
Better World #1 is a group of five borrowers, led by Jarmie Alfred, living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Jarmie is 38 years old and married with three children aged 5-25, and one grandchild. Only one of her children is in school; the others were required to work or beg during the war. Jarmie was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. Jarmie lives in remote Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Jarmie’s business is dry goods, including spices, soup cubes, matches, palm oil, rice, flour, etc. She buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall alongside approximately one hundred other vendors of various trades.
