She has run her business for three years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic.

Jarmie is taking the loan to increase her inventory of rice, beans, and oil which sell well in this season. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have a bigger table in the market and ultimately to have her own shop. With the profits from her business Jarmie dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, and oil for her business

loans.name: Raufboy

texts.en:
Raufboy A. is a married father of three children. He is a farmer, and in spite of his youth he supports his family with hard work and dedication. He is always in the fields growing grapes, leaving early in the morning to water the fields and then fertilize and fumigate the crops. This work is satisfying, and it enables him to purchase goods for his home. Raufboy would like to request a loan of 7000 Somoni which he can use to buy necessary farm inputs like fertilizers since they are very expensive. He is very optimistic that this amount will improve his yield and he hopes to have a continuous partnership with the lenders. Raufboy always makes sure that he respects the people around him since he believes that respect begets respect.     
 
About Tajikistan:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.  But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's history:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: United Friends Progressive Organization Group

texts.en:
United Friends Progressive Organization is a group of 4 borrowers led by Martin G., who is 51 years old.  He is married with 6 children between the ages of four and 26, and their educational levels range from kindergarten to the 11th grade.  He also cares for an orphan.  Martin is a high school graduate but could not continue university due to poverty.  He and his family live on the 20th Street, Sinkor, a community mixed with poor and middle class Liberians.  Martin happens to fall in the poorer part of Sinkor, south of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.

Martin’s business is shoe sales.  He buys shoes wholesale and sells them for retail in downtown Monrovia, Liberia.  He has been running this business for 25 years and is hoping to improve his business to the highest level possible.  Martin started by working as a salesman for his brother but later decided to establish his own business.  Since Martin started his business, he always keeps his goods clean and arranged in an ideal location to attract customers, and during transactions he approaches them in a good manner in order to encourage them to always buy from him.  Martin needs this loan in order to buy more goods to serve customers.  He dreams of  giving his children a better education to prepare them for the future to come.

loans.use: Martin needs this loan in order to buy more goods to serve customers

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles T. is a single young man, born in 1988. He lives in Marigat Town, in the Rift-Valley Province of Kenya.  This is his third loan with KADET. His previous loans have been worth Kshs 80,000 and Kshs 30,000.

Charles Torotich runs a wholesale store in Marigat Town. He started in the wholesale business two years ago. His sells cooking oil, detergents and foodstuffs in his shop. Charles gets a profit of Kshs 20,000 every month from the wholesale business. He gets additional income from running a posho mill which is in the same town as his wholesale business.

Charles' business is situated within the residential estates of Marigat with a variety of customers ranging from small shops, hotels and supermarkets. This loan will be used to increase the stock in his shop.

If this loan boosts his business, Charles plans to buy a plot of land on which he will build a business structure so that he will not pay rent anymore, thus maximizing his profits. He dreams of expanding his business beyond Marigat and purchasing a lorry for easy and efficient transportation of goods.

He describes himself as a passionate business man who is focused on achieving set targets and future dreams.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase supplies for his wholesale business (items such as cooking oil, detergents, food)

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu H. is 25 years old and is married with one child of 8 months. He lives in the Kicukiro district where he has had a shop selling a variety of shoes since 2001. The hours of his business requires that he works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Jean de Dieu, after realizing that his working capital is still inadequate to grow his business with new offerings, is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. He needs the loan in order to purchase a variety of more attractive shoes which he hopes will increase the number of his customers as well as his profits.

If this strategy is successful, Jean de Dieu will be able to continue to build a secure future for himself and his child.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of more attractive shoes and handbags

loans.name: Rachel Florentine

texts.fr: A. Rachel Florentine est née vers 1975 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Mariée à SOSSOU Germain un conducteur de taxi moto, Rachel Florentine est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Rachel Florentine vit avec ses enfants à Ahito à Allada, depuis près de 7 ans.  Rachel Florentine supporte seule les charges de la famille. Rachel Florentine a fait seulement le cours primaire à l'école. Depuis environs 5 ans, Rachel Florentine vend de la nourriture (come, nourriture traditionnelle faite à base de maïs, accompagnée de sauce) à Allada. A côté de cette activité, Rachel Florentine vend également des tissus par le système de distribution. Rachel Florentine s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. C'est en vue d'accroître son activité et donc de préparer et de vendre davantage son repas par jour, que Rachel Florentine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Rachel Florentine was born in 1975 in Allada, in the county of Atlantique in Bénin. Rachel Florentine is married to Sossou Germain, a motorcycle taxi conductor. They have 5 children, some of whom are currently attending school. Rachel Florentine has lived with her children in Ahito, within Allada, for the past 7 years. Rachel Florentine carries the load of her family alone. Rachel Florentine only attended primary school. For the past 5 years, Rachel Florentine has sold foodstuffs ("come", a traditional corn-based food, accompanied with sauce) in Allada. In addition to this, Rachel Florentine also sells fabrics through her distribution system. Rachel Florentine supplies herself in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Rachel Florentine is an old client of ALIDé, who has already benefitted from three loans from ALIDé, these loans have all been fully repaid. In order to grow her business, and therefore to prepare and sell more meals everyday, Rachel Florentine is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of corn and sauces (tomato, onion, spicy, etc.)

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamin es chofer propietario de minibús trabaja como transportista interprovincial La Paz – Tiquina; la esposa trabaja como empleada domestica y  así generan sus ingresos con que cubren la manutención de su familia. Vive en casa alquilada ubicado en  la Zona Villa Bolivar D de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinara a la reparación de su herramienta de trabajo (minibus) para poder continuar prestando servicio de transporte publico.
 
Es segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Benjamin is the driver-owner of a minibus and works as an interprovincial carrier between La Paz and Tiquina. His wife works as a housekeeper and thus they generate the income with which they cover the family expenses. He lives in a rented house which is located in Villa Bolivar Zone D in the city of El Alto.

The loan is intended for the repair of his work tool (minibus) in order to continue being able to offer public transit service.

This is his second loan with IMPRO. Good payment history allows him to apply for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of his minibus.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
La señora Rosibel G. se dedica a trabajar a diario en su propia casa de habitación en el municipio de Nagarote donde se ha destacado como una excelente costurera que realiza todo tipo de trabajos en tela como vestidos, camisas, entre otros.

Ella trabaja tanto por encargo como productos realizados para venderlos en los mercados de Managua. El crédito que ella está solicitando es para invertirlo en la compra de tela para realizar uniformes escolares ya que se aproxima el año escolar y por tal razón debe vender uniformes escolares para así obtener ganancias y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y de su mamá que también se ha dedicado a la costura. Es importante destacar que ella es soltera y no tiene hijos por lo que vela por el bienestar de su mamá.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosibel Gonzalez is dedicated to work daily from her house in the city of Nagarote, where she has stood out as a great seamstress that makes all types of works such as dresses, shirts and others.

She works by demand as well to sell products at the Managua's markets. She requests this loan to buy fabric to make school uniforms, since the school year is close by. She must sell school uniforms to make a profit and improve her life conditions, as well as the life conditions of her mother, who is also dedicated to sewing. It is important to bring enphasis to the fact that she is single with no children, and she looks for her mother's welfare.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric to make school uniforms

loans.name: Aneta

texts.en:
Aneta T. is 30 and married with 2 children (ages 5 - 7years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Aneta has many years of experience in this business.  Aneta needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 120 tala or US $50 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Aneta joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Aneta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Aneta T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2.2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2.2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

You can view pictures of a typical vegetable garden in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/VegetableGarden#

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
Mrs. Duk T., age 42, owns a plot of farmland where she plants a varieT. crops, including rice, morning glory, cucumbers and cabbage, that she sells when they mature. She has a partner in her husband who assists with her on the farm field. This couple has seven children, two of whom are married and the others are single. Three of their sons are construction laborers.

Duk T. and her family members always pay money for taxis because they do not own a vehicle of their own for traveling needs. In order to cut down on this expenditure, Duk T. is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle which she will use for transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to use for transportation

loans.name: Atilano

texts.es:
El señor Atilano esta casado con la señora Silvia Noguera con quien tiene 5 hijos, Gloria de 33 años, Maria de 32 años, Norma de 30 años, Juan de 23 años y Marcelo de 20 años.
Cuando Atilano tenia 18 años de edad su madre le pidió para que le repare su radio, entonces don Atilano se puso a experimentar por la citada radio, hasta que pudo solucionar el desperfecto. Fue así que desidio estudiar electrónica que le llevo 3 años de estudio, al terminar los mismo desidio abrir su propio local de reparación de televisores y radios.
Desde entonces tiene una buena cantidad de cliente.
Atilano Hemosilla decidió comprar un vehículo para el traslado de los televisores, radios y otros artículos de electrónica que repara a los domicilios de los diferentes clientes
En un futuro próximo Atilano quiere seguir ampliando su clientela y continuar perfeccionándose con sus 61 años.
texts.en:
Atilano is married to Silvia Noguera. They have five children: Gloria, 33, Maria, 32, Norma, 30, Juan, 23, and Marcelo, 20. When Atilano was 18 years old, his mother asked him to repair her radio. Atilano started to tinker with the radio until he was able to figure out how to repair it. This led him to study electronics; it took him three years. When he finished his training, he opened a radio and television repair shop. Since then, he has had a good number of customers. Atilano H. decided to buy a vehicle to transport the television sets, radios and other electric appliances that he repairs, to his customers' homes. In the future, Atilano wants to continue to expand his customer base and continue, even at the age of 61, to self improve.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional used cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap S. is a 32-year-old married woman who lives in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in the Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ry Neat, are farmers who own a 2.50-hectare field and cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mr. Ry Neat owns a trailer for transporting sand to sell. He can earn a small income to support his family. 

Although they try to work hard with their different businesses, they still earn less than they need to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Sopheap S. now is requesting 1,000,000 Riels from AMK, a Kiva partner, to buy five piglets for breeding and pig food. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family's living conditions. This couple has two children who all both students in the local school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy five piglets and pig food

loans.name: Ko

texts.en:
Every morning, Mrs. Ko C. goes out from her home to buy different kinds of vegetable from farmers. She hurries to bring the vegetables to sell in the local market, from which she earns a living. 

Her husband also earns money by planting rice. Additionally, he has a cultivating machine that he uses to provide a plowing service for a fee. Ko C. has five kids; one is married and the others are single. Two of her sons are construction laborers in Phnom Penh. Ko C. is taking out her loan to buy a used vehicle for her family’s travelling needs. Any remaining cash from the loan, Ko C. will use to repair her existing house which is frequently in need of repairs.

loans.use: To buy a used vehicle

loans.name: Bolo

texts.fr: Madame Bolo M.  s’active dans le commerce depuis 1989. Elle vend près de l’hôpital régional de Thiès. Elle y étale des fruits (banane, pommes, oranges, melon….).  Elle sollicite cependant un crédit de 75 000 FCFA pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bolo M. has been involved in commercial activities since 1989. She offers fruit for sale (bananas, apples, oranges, melons, …) next to the regional hospital in Thiès. She is requesting a loan of 75,000 FCFA to strengthen her activity.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fruit for her business

loans.name: Juani

texts.es: LA SRA. JUANI ESTA CASADA TIENE HIJOS YA MAYORES, VIVE SOLO CON SU ESPOSO, LA CLIENTE SE DEDICA  A LA VENTA DE COMIDA  TIENE MAS DE 20 AÑOS DE ANTIGUEDAD Y DE EXPERIENCIA , CUENTA CON UN PUESTO EN EL MERCADO CENTRAL DE SACABA QUE ESTA UBICADO A UN CUADRA DE LA PLAZA PRINCIPAL. ES UN MERCADO MODERNO Y NUEVO ESTA UBICADA EN EL SECTOR DE COMIDAS, TIENE BASTANTES CLIENTE QUE FRECUENTAN EN SU NEGOCIO . TIENE CASA PROPIA ES DE CLASE HUMILDE Y SENCILLA. EL CREDITO QUE SOLICITA ES PARA MEJORAR EL NEGOCIO COMPRAR NUEVAS OLLAS , MESAS Y SILLAS PARA MEJORAR SU PUESTO, LA SRA. JUANI ESMUY TRABAJADORA DESDE MUY NIÑA TRABAJO EN LA VENTA DE COMIDAS, CUENTA QUE LE GUSTA COCINAR QUE CADA PLATO LO PREPARA CON MUCHO CARIÑO PARA SUS CLIENTES, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
La señora Juani is married, and her children are adults. She lives alone with her husband. She has more than twenty years of seniority and experience selling food. She has a food stall in the central market, located one block from the main plaza. The market is new and modern. Her stall is located in a food court, and she has many customers. The home that she owns is humble and simple. She is applying for a loan to improve her business, to buy new pots, tables, and chairs. La señora Juani is a very hard worker. She has sold food since she was a young girl. She says that she likes to cook and that she prepares each dish for her customers with much affection. She is very grateful to Emprender (local lending institution) and Kiva for the trust they have displayed by loaning money to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es: Asunta es una mujer muy emprendedora empezó sus negocios con los prestamos de Edaprospo. Con mucho esfuerzo pudo aperturar una jugueria, además vio las necesidades de sus vecinos y aperturar un bazar donde vende diversos productos y regalos. Con el crédito obtenido lo invertirá en comprar algunos estantes para aperturar una ferretería,  La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cancelar sugun su cronograma. seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
Asunta is a very enterprising woman who started her business with loans from Edaprospo. With much effort she was able to open a juice bar. She also saw seomthing her neighbors' needed and opened a variety store where she sells diverse products and gifts. With the loan she will invest in buying some shelves to open a hardware store. This member is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it off according to schedule. Edaprospo seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products.

loans.name: Sam-Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-ol T.  is 27 years old and her husband, Mr. Sam-ol Yong, is 34 years old. They have been married since 2006 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both of them still young.

Mrs. Sam-ol T. has been a scarf weaver since 2008, a skill she learned from her mother-in-law. Her husband is a barber. She is asking for her first loan of $150 to purchase cotton thread for her scarf-weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase cotton thread for her scarf-weaving business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita P. is from the village of Lugait Misamis oriental. She is 55 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Amelita owns & operates a specialized retail store that sells a variety of household items to the local community. Amelita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amelita joined HSPFI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Amelita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Amelita's 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her retail store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna, 29, is a resident of the town of Machakos, where she lives with her husband and two children. She has been operating a retail shop where she sells sweets, bread, sugar and sodas. She has been in the business for two years.  She has many customers and employs one person to assist her in running the business in case she goes out to get more stock. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to increase her stock. She dreams of building her own house in the future.

loans.use: To buy sweets, bread, sugar and sodas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more bead-working materials

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn J. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 31 years old. Rubelyn is married and has four young children. Her eldest is seven years old, while the youngest is only one year old. To make a living, Rubelyn grows crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rubelyn also raises hogs for fattening and sale.

Rubelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rubelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rubelyn is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rubelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and fertilizers

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie D., age 31, is married and has three children currently attending high school. She and her husband work hard each day to cover daily expenses and the cost of their children's education. Virgie runs her own store selling fishballs, squidballs, and ice cream, among other goods, and generates PHP5,000 a month in earnings.

Virgie has requested a loan of Php28,000 to help her expand her inventory and attract more customers.  The new loan will allow her to buy groceries in bulk, saving money on transportation. She hopes that with more working capital her business will generate more stable revenues for her and her family.

Virgie has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since 2005 and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.*  She hopes to someday further expand her business and fully fund her children's education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Rose Ndavu

texts.en: Rose Ndavu K. is a 35-year-old lady married to Mwaniki K.. They have two children, ages 3 and 10. They live in Kimumu, outside of Eldoret town. Rose has a grocery store where she earn her income. She has been in this business for the past five years with an income of 2,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. Ndavu was introduced to KADET by a friend, and she is applying for her first loan of 10,000 KES with KADET. With this loan, she plans to buy bananas, tomatoes, onions, carrots, pilipili hoho (hot pepper sauce) and Irish potatoes. She hopes to operate a large scale grocery, whereby she can supply hotels (restaurants) and sell the best quality for her customers. In the future, she hopes to extend the same services to the city centre.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, tomatoes, onions, carrots, pilipili hoho and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Félicia

texts.fr: félicia est une femme veuve qui a 2 personnes à sa charge. elle exerce comme activité le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis plus de 10 ans et maîtrise donc ce commerce. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle voudrait agrandir son stock et sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 15 sacs de riz, 20 bidons d'huile et divers produits d'alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Felicia, a widow with two dependents, makes a living selling general food products. She has been doing this for over ten years and has a good command of her activity. Her customer base is very diverse. She wishes to increase her stocks and is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase 15 bags of rice, 20 cans of oil, and various other general food items.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria L. is 46 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the town of Lopez Jaena located in Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Maria runs a clothing business where she provides new clothing to the local community. Maria has been in business for over twelve years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2004 Maria joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Maria is requesting a new loan, her sixteenth from PMPC, of 20,000 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her clothing business

loans.name: Sénom

texts.fr: sénom est une femme de 31 ans, elle est célibataire; pour subvenir à ses besoins, elle a entamée le commerce de produits cosmétiques. Elle a une ancienneté de 2 ans dans ce commerce et exerce son activité au marché local de Hedzranawoé. la demande de sa clientèle est de plus en plus élevée raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 5 cartons déodorants, 6 cartons de parfums pour hommes et pour dames.
texts.en: Sénom is a 31-year old woman. She is single. In order to support herself, she sells cosmetic products. She has two years of experience in this business and sells at the local market in Hedzranawoé. The customer demand keeps growing, which is why she is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase five boxes of deodorants and six boxes of men’s and women’s perfumes.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics

loans.name: Pastorcitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Pastorcitas y se ubica en la comunidad de puente de Ixtla en el estado de Morelos en México, esta comunidad se distingue por los  balnearios que existen en la región y el lago de Tequesquitengo lo que hace a la región un atractivo turístico, el grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. 
Delfina Jiménez García es integrante del grupo , ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas hechas a mano, negocio que inicio hace 4 años, solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas, tiene 59 años estudio hasta el 5º año de primaria, es casada,  tiene en total 5 hijos de 42,36,34,32 y 24 años respectivamente. Al momento  de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque en el mismo local donde vende las tortillas planea poner una  negocio  de tacos al pastor, quiere este crédito para comprar los utensilios para la elaboración de los tacos, con la ganancia que obtenga, piensa comprar mesas y sillas para su taquería.
texts.en:
This group is called Pastorcitas and is located in the community of Puente de Ixtla in Morelos State, Mexico.  The community is distinguished by the spas that exist in the region and Lake Tequesquitengo, which makes the region an attractive tourist spot.  The group is composed of 10 members.

Delfina Jiménez García is a member of the group.  She sells handmade tortillas, a business that started 4 years ago.  She is seeking a loan to buy corn for making tortillas.  She is 59 years old, has a 5th grade education, is married and has a total of 5 children, ages 42, 36, 34, 32, and 24 respectively.  As she is requesting the loan, she is happy because in the same place where she sells tortillas, she plans to start a business of selling tacos al pastor (pork tacos).  She wants this loan to buy utensils for taco preparation.  With the earnings she generates, she is thinking of buying tables and chairs for her taco stand.

loans.use: To invest in her taco business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To tock bags of rice, beans, and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
Farhod lives and works in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He owns a business selling clothing and footwear at the local market. His vending kiosk offers a wide variety of merchandise that is regularly restocked. Affordable prices and a nice selection have helped Farhod stay afloat with his business for six years. In fact, he has not only managed to keep his business sustainable and profitable, but has also increased his working capital. Farhod decided to go into this line of business because competition is lacking. He feels comfortable selling this type of inventory. Farhod is a focused entrepreneur looking for growth and further expansion of his venture. He believes an increase in assorted merchandise will guarantee increased sales and consistent development of his business. Farhod is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to increase his working capital. 
                                                                                    
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to increase the range of goods to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna M. is 39 years old, married, and lives in the province of Antipolo, Rizal, in the Philippines with her husband and four minor children. To make a better living, Edna owns and operates a business of retailing of dry goods and RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes) in her neighborhood. 

She has been a busy entrepreneur for almost three years. Edna would like to receive a loan to purchase more inventory of dried goods and RTW. Edna believes in offering a variety of products in her house for customers seeking convenient purchases. 

Her long term goals are to expand her retailing business and sustain her family financially.  With the support of Kiva lenders, she is focused to develop a winning business with her entrepreneurial effort.  

Edna is grateful for the secured access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders across the world for offering her financial support and a chance to reach her dreams in life. She prays that they all will be blessed.

loans.use: Will pay for inventories of dry goods and RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes).

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Rosa; La socia tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanía, ella  hace y también compra artesanía, la socia elabora a mano y también ya le traen sus proveedores diferentes tipos de arte local y andinos, son trabajos realizados en arcilla con motivos andinos que representar las vivencias de cada pueblo y el paisaje con sus típicos aves, nevados, cerros, animales y casas típicas. La socia también pinta según los diseños ella tiene su stand en el centro artesanal Inti Pakareq; La socia desea el crédito para poder hacer de el un capital de trabajo para implementar su stand y comprar adornos de cerámica y también materia prima para elaborar ella misma junto a su familia diversos trabajos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar algunos trabajos de arcilla y también comprar materia prima.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "INTI QUILLA" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Rosa is 45 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  Her business is buying and selling handicrafts.  She makes and also buys handicrafts.  She makes her items by hand and also receives different types of local and Andean art from her suppliers.  These are objects made with clay, bearing Andean motifs which represent the experiences of each village and the landscape with its typical birds, clouds, hills, animals and traditional houses.  Rosa also paints.  She has a stand in the Inti Pakareq craft center.

Rosa would like this loan so that she can use it as working capital to keep her stand running, buying ceramic ornaments and raw materials for making different crafts together with her family.

Rosa is happy to be receiving this loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy some ceramic ornaments and also to buy raw materials

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is married to M. M. who is daily wage laborer. His income is not guaranteed because sometimes he gets work and sometimes not. In order to assist him financially Khalida started an artificial jewelry business eight years ago. She collects orders from different jewelry shops and fills them on time to make an income. 

She belongs to Khanewal, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, famous for its agriculture industry. She has lived there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Khurram Pura for the past 20 years. She has given birth to four sons. Her oldest son works in a government organization, and the next oldest is a daily wage laborer. Only her youngest son is able to attend school, and he is studying in kindergarten. 

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her jewelry selling business. With the loan, she will buy jewelry like earrings, rings and necklaces in bulk to fulfill larger orders on time and to make extra income.  

She is very hopeful that the loan investment will take her business to a more profitable position. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khalida”.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Elvin Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Elvin Antonio P. L. labora en el Municipio de Granada del Departamento de Granada, desde hace nueve años en el cargo de Operador de Pozo, con este ingreso mantiene a su familia el cual es te cuatro personas.

La necesidad que se le presenta a este señor es que desea realiza un mejoramiento de vivienda y para hacer realizad este sueño visita las oficinas de CEPRODEL con el fin de solicitar un crédito y llevar a cabo lo puesto en el plan de inversión, y así poder sentirse que le está dando o aportando a un mejor futuro a sus hijos ya que le está dando un techo seguro y digno.
texts.en:
Sr. Elvin Antonio P. L. has worked in the town of Granada, Department of Granada, for the past nine years as a well operator. The income he earns supports his family, which consists of four people.

Sr. Elvin needs to complete a home improvement and decided to accomplish this objective by visiting the offices of CEPRODEL to request a loan. This will enable him to carry out this investment plan. He feels this will provide a better future for his children as well as a safe and decent home.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 52-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in her own house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in bananas for 15 years. She started her business with capital of 200,000 UGX and now her working capital is 1,000,000 UGX. Her main business challenge is price fluctuation and her vision is to be the leading supplier of bananas in the region. Christine is requesting a loan to buy bananas for resale.

loans.use: To buy bananas for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old single woman living with her parents and three siblings. She is from Lebanon. She has owned a CD, gift and perfume shop since 2005. In parallel, she works as a sports coach in a local school. Her work is very important because she helps her father with the family expenses. She obtained her first Kiva loan and she has been an excellent client with prompt payments. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her shop’s inventory, as she wants to purchase the new perfume collections in addition to some original gifts. In the future, she is planning to expand her business and enlarge her store.

loans.use: To increase her shop’s inventory

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma lives in Jaranwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan famous for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family. She is a working woman who shares the financial burden with her family by selling clothes. She started this business 5 years ago. She receives orders from her clients and fulfills them by purchasing clothes from Lahore city. She travels to Lahore once a month for this purpose. Najma is married to M. S., who works in a government school for a low income. She has given birth to 3 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son has a private job. The second one has a construction supplies business, while her younger children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her clothes selling business. She will use the loan money to buy clothes in bulk quantity which will help her offer more variety of clothes to her clients and make more profits. Bulk purchasing will also cut her costs of transportation. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her forth loan application. She has proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time in previous loan years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Najma.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Mbene

texts.fr: Madame Mbene S. est une femme mariée  de 43 ans qui habite à Yoff. Elle évolue dans la vente de poissons depuis plus de 10ans. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi pour avoir les moyens d’épauler son mari. Aussi elle veut lutter contre l’oisiveté. Elle est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis longtemps. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle emprunte 100 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son fond de roulement. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses revenus à travers ce financement afin de parvenir à constituer une épargne et démarrer  un petit commerce parallèle. L’idée  est de diversifier  les produits qu’elle vend.
texts.en: Madam Mbene S. is 43 year-old married woman and lives in Yoff. She sells fish for more than 10 years, she chose to do it to help her husband and to keep herself busy. She has been a member of our branch in Yoff for a long long time now and she paid off a previous loan. She borrows a 100 000 frs loan to increase her working capital. Her goal is to increase her revenue, to be able to save money and to start a small business on the side. The idea is to diversify the products she sells.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Amonjon

texts.en:
Amonjon is married and has three children. He sells men's shirts and fabrics for sewing women's national dresses. Vladimir has been in this business for six years. He inherited the business from his parents. Amonjon is young and is full of energy to develop this business further, for it is the only income for his family. Amonjon would like to borrow $2000 US to increase the assortment of goods he sells. He plans to increase sales during the coming summer season and he needs to get ready for it. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy men's shirts, and fabrics used for women's national dresses

loans.name: Jose Ofilio

texts.es:
José, reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, vive con su madre, es soltero, y comenzó por la necesidad de proveer para su madre ingresos y cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo comprar cerdos y materiales  agrícolas como abono y fertilizantes, esta compra es una gran ayuda para crecer y ampliar en sus dos ocupaciones, atendiendo siempre la agricultura y creciendo con su granja de cerdos.
Él aspira desarrollarse en sus negocios, mejorar las condiciones de  vida de su familia y trabajar casa día por superarse.
texts.en: José lives in El Transito, department of San Miguel, and makes a living in agriculture and livestock. He lives with his mother, is single and started working out of the necessity to provide income for his mother and cover household expenses. Currently he is requesting a loan to purchase pigs and agricultural materials such as manure and fertilizer. This purchase will be a great help in growing and expanding his two operations, tending to his crops and growing his pigs. He hopes to develop his businesses, improve his family's living conditions and works hard every day to move up in life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and agricultural materials like manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas, age 54, is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for years. She also raises pigs. She is a widow and currently lives with her son and daughter-in-law, who supply her with a portion of their salary for house expenses. One of Mrs. Meas's childen is employed in a garment factory while the other one still studies in secondary school. 

In order to earn extra income, Mrs. Meas will be using her loan to buy more pig feed and piglets to raise, as well as to buy seeds for planting in the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy more pig feed and piglets to raise, as well as to buy seeds for planting in the rainy season

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon, aged 32, is a village woman living in Prey Chor district of Phnom Penh City. She sells a variety of merchandise and has been running this business since 2000. She earns around $1.75 each day to cover her family's expenses. Her husband is a domestic farmer who has been earning money by cultivating rice for many years ago. Mrs. Phon has four single children; most of them are students at the local school. Mrs. Phon would like to request a loan to buy some fertilizers for their crop growing. With the rest of the funds, she will purchase a piece of farmland from her neighbor to increase the size of their crops. This loan will provide her entire family with an additional fixed asset.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to purchase a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is a 19-year-old housewife and mother of Ahmad, who is one year old. Her husband is a taxi driver; he started this profession three years ago,  transporting passengers between the south and north areas of Rafah in Gaza Strip. 

Haneen's husband (who appears in the picture) saved up a good amount of the car's purchase price and needed the $1,500 that Haneen borrowed from FATEN to buy the car. Owning the car will bring in a better income to support the family.

Haneen is a religious woman therefore she refused to be photographed.

loans.use: to buy the taxi her husband drives passengers with

loans.name: Agam

texts.en:
Agam is 31 years-old .  She is married and has 2 children, ages 15 and 7.  In 2000, she established her business of raising cows.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase a young dairy cow. 

In the future, Agam plans to  expand the business.  She thanks you for your support. Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young dairy cow

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is age 45 and a married mother of five children, four of whom are currently attending school. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 30 years in her hometown in eastern Kenya. Her mixed farm produces bananas, maize and milk, which she sells to the local market. Farming has been her main source of income and she is glad that the income from her farm has enabled her to cater to her family's needs. 

Lucy has made a loan request of 60,000 KES to buy chickens and poultry feed for her poultry farm. She says that the income that will be generated through this project will be used to pay school fees for her children. Her primary challenges in farming have been delay in payment by debtors and the high cost of animal feed, which affects her output. In the future, she plans to expand her farming activities and to sell her products to a wider market.

loans.use: To buy chickens and poultry feed

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 39 years old. He is married to three wives, Beatrice, Seline and Eunice, and they have seven children.

He is a fishmonger and has been in business for the last fifteen years. He is applying for KES. 75,000 to enable him to buy another boat and fishing net to enable him to do his business well.

The profits made will help him take care of his three families well and enable him to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to have a big supply of fish in the area.

loans.use: To buy a boat and a fishing net.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina has two children. Both of the children are in school. She is a married woman. She took a loan from BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profit from her business for pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks like cold water,`soda,and beer to sell

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima  est un homme âgé de 44 ans. Il est marié et vit au Sénégal. Il est couturier  dans un marché de la place non loin de son domicile. Il a choisit son métier par amour, mais aussi  dans le but de se procurer des revenus stables. Il est membre dans l’un des guichets de  l’U-IMCEC  depuis le mois de juin dernier. Il sollicite un crédit de 75 000 Prévu pour l’achat d’une nouvelle machine à coudre plus performante. Son objectif  est de répondre aux besoins de ses clients en cette veille de fête de Korité. L’augmentation de ses revenus lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins et de mieux supporter les charges familiales.
texts.en: Mr Ibrahima is 44 years old and married. He lives in Senegal. He is a tailor working at a market located just a short way from his home. His love for this profession and the need to earn a regular income induced him to become a tailor. He has been a member of one of the branches of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC since June 2011. He applies for a loan of 75,000 CFA francs which he needs to buy a new and better performing sewing machine. His goal is to meet the needs of his customers as the festivities of Korité approach, which mark the end of the holy month of Ramadan. His higher income will enable him to provide for his needs and better support his family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Zonia Yolanda

texts.es:
Zonia, vive con su familia, tiene un hijo D. 8 años D. edad, ella administra una tienda, todos los días esta atendiéndola, sin un horario fijo, ella y su hijo depenD. D. los ingresos que le genera la tienda.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería, como jabón, detergentes, pastas, aceite, boquitas, gaseosas y jugos, estos productos le ayudaran para fortalecer el negocio, estar atenta al servicio D. los clientes.
Su propósito es que a través D. los préstamos pueda crecer, con el objetivo D. apoyar a su hijo y cubrir todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Zonia lives with her family.  She has an 8-year-old son and runs a store.  She works in her store every day but doesn't work fixed hours.  She and her son depend on the income that she makes from her store.

Zonia is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as soap, detergents, pasta, oil, snacks, soda and juice.  These products will help her to strengthen her business and proviD. good customer service.  Her goal is to grow her business through loans.  She thereby hopes to support her son and cover his needs.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergents, pasta, oil, snacks, soda and juice

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura tiene 34 años, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Efraín de 35 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor bienestar. Maura, acentúa que todo lo que va obteniendo es a base de tenacidad y entrega a sus cultivos de cacao, café y palta, es por ello que trata de dar el mejor cuidado respectivo a sus plantaciones y bajo esa premisa es que muchos de sus compradores se han sentido satisfechos  por la calidad de lo que cosecha. Sin embargo, ella trata de esmerarse a diario y le dedica buen tiempo a sus sembrios y lo realiza conjuntamente con la ayuda de su pareja, sin embargo en tiempos de cosecha necesariamente contrata jornaleros para acelerar en la extracción y carguio de sus productos y fruto a su esfuerzo cotidiano está obteniendo buenos ingresos económicos. Con el crédito solicitado comprará mas plantas de palto ya que tiene previsto injertarlos a medida que van desarrollándose. Su plan a futuro es invertir sus ingresos en otro tipo de negocios como crianza de ovinos. Este es será su primer crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo financiero y esta dispuesta a cumplir puntualmente con el rol de sus cronogramas de pago. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles solicitados comprara mas plantas de palto para posteriormente injertarlos y sacar provecho de los frutos en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Maura is 34 years old.  She is a native of the city of Santa Rosa, and is a hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home with her partner Efraín, aged 35, and their three beloved children, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

Maura emphasizes that everything she has accomplished has been due to her tenacity and the care she gives to her crops of cocoa, coffee and avocados.  She tries to give her plantations the best care possible, and as a result of that premise, many of her buyers have been been satisfied by the quality of the products she harvests.  Nonetheless, she tries to do more on a daily basis, and dedicates a good amount of time to her crops.  While she also has the support of her partner in her work, when it comes to harvest time it is necessary for her to hire workers to speed up the harvesting and haulage of her products.  The fruit of her daily efforts is that she earns a good income.

With the requested loan, Mercedes will buy more avocado plants, as she has plans for grafting them as they grow.  

Her plan for the future is to invest her income in another type of business, such as raising sheep.

This will be her first loan, and she is very happy to know that she can count on the financial support.  She is ready to comply punctually with her repayment schedule.  With the 1,500 New Soles requested, she will buy more avocado plants for grafting at a later point, and will make a profit from the fruit in a short time-period.

loans.use: to buy more avocado plants.

loans.name: Mirzo

texts.ru: Мирзо проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам он имеет среднее образование. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает мужскую одежду и обувь. В этой области он 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки осеней обуви.
texts.en: Mirzo lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 43 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is involved in household work.  Mirzo has a secondary education.  He leases a retail outlet, where he sells men's clothing and shoes.  He has been in this business for 10 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fall shoes.

loans.use: to purchase fall shoes

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 39-year-old single mother of one child. She runs a tailoring business and has been in this business for the last two years. 

Asha was recently introduced to KADET LTD and this marks her first loan. Her business is doing well and with this loan she plans to purchase cloth materials, thread, buttons and zippers for her business. 

The profits that will be generated will be directed to the repayment of the loan and gradual expansion of her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, thread, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 33 years old. She is married with two children.

Catherine has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Catherine has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future,Catherine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell, like snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: José Roberto se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hace más de 6 años que tiene de poseer este medio de vida. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de  pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, vestidos, ropa para niños. Todos los días comienza este negocio desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar variedad en productos. El propósito de José es seguir progresando con su negocio y ser un buen cliente para otros préstamos futuros y poder ir al día con la cuota.
texts.en:
José Roberto sells clothing. This has been his livelihood for more than six years. The purpose of the loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, dresses, and children's clothing. 

He works in his business everyday from 7:00 in the morning to 7:00 in the evening, so the majority of his customers come to him to buy a variety of products. 

Jose's intention is to continue moving forward with his business, to be a good client for other future loans, and to be up to date with his instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, dresses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and lives with her spouse and children in the Alibagu Province of Isabela. Her spouse helps with her business, and her daughter is a student. She runs a grocery shop business. 

Now that winter is approaching, she saw a business opportunity to sell firewood in her shop. She is a sharp and hard-working woman who says, "I am the only one in my family with the income, so I have to work [as] hard as possible in order to support them."

She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy different products such as snack foods, spices, sugar, and firewood for her shop.

She hopes that someday she can improve her store to make more income, so her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy different products such as snack foods, spices, sugar, and firewood for her shop.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 50-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Bernadette has a shop that sells rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy sacks of rice to be sold retail.

Bernadette has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Bernadette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to be sold retail.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo, de 42 años de edad, es un hombre empeñoso y trabajador, además de sociable y alegre, es casado con Madeleine quien es comerciante independiente, vive en compañía de su esposa, sus dos hijos de 12 y 10 años de edad y su madre a la que cuida por su edad avanzada, todos cómodamente instalados en su casa propia que logró comprar con mucho esfuerzo. Jairo se dedica al servicio de trasporte de pasajeros, iniciándose hace 4 años con la compra de un automóvil con la liquidación que recibió al salir de su trabajo en una empresa privada, y viendo la necesidad de ocuparse en alguna actividad decidió por el transporte. Es así que logró crecer con este nuevo negocio y en la actualidad cuenta con dos autos y una moto taxi, donde  él maneja el auto y el otro vehículo lo alquila, lo mismo hace con la moto taxi, teniendo de esa manera varios ingresos. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le genera y le permite solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Al contrario, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es el estrés y cansancio visual que le ocasiona el estar muchas horas en el volante manejando su auto, por eso tiene planes de cambiar de actividad y ampliando su casa y  construir una quinta en donde pueda alquilar habitaciones. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus miembros y los considera buenas personas y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de sus vehículos, comprando llantas, fajas, y servicios de mano de obra en el arreglo de sus autos.
texts.en:
42-year-old Jairo is a determined and hard-working man.  He is also sociable and cheerful.  He is married to Madeleine who is an independent saleswoman.  Jairo lives together with his wife, his two children (12 and 10 years old), and his mother who he cares for owing to her old age.  They all live comfortably in their own home which Jairo managed to buy with a lot of effort.

Jairo's business is transporting passengers.  He started four years ago, buying  a vehicle with the severance pay that he received when he left his job at a private company.  He saw the need to start working in a business activity and chose transportation.  He managed to grow his new business and currently has two cars and a motorcycle taxi.  He drives one of the cars himself and hires the other one out (he does the same with the motorcycle taxi).  In this way, he makes several incomes.  What Jairo enjoys about his work is the income that it makes and the fact that it allows him to cover his household expenses and his children's education expenses.  On the contrary, what he does not enjoy about his work is the stress and the eye strain which he suffers from because he spends so many hours at the wheel, driving his car.  For this reason, he has plans to change his business, expand his house and build a property where he can rent out rooms. 

This will Jairo's fourth loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive your cooperation so that he can realize his plans.  He says that he feels comfortable with his community bank because he knows the members and he considers them to be good, responsible people.  With the sum of 1,500 soles he has requested, Jairo will invest in having his vehicles serviced, buying tires, belts, and paying labor costs to the mechanic who will repair his vehicles.

loans.use: to buy tires and belts, and to hire a mechanic to service his vehicles

loans.name: Akuju

texts.en: Akuju, a 25-year-old married woman, has had a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for three years. Now requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase green vegetables and sweet potatoes, she will use the resulting extra income to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Due to hardships of life, Marlon did not pursue his studies in college. He helped his parents in cultivating their farmland until he decided to get married and settle down. He is now 25 years old and  has one infant child. He plans to earn and save more income to build his own house and start a business for his wife to manage.

In this regard, he plans to expand his corn farm to ensure a high production. He is requesting for additional capital in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy the necessary agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers and insecticides, as well as labor costs, required in planting corn. He believes that through patience and sacrifice, he will be successful in carrying out his plans.

loans.use: to buy the necessary agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers and insecticides, as well as labor costs, required in planting corn.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 63 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 8 children.
Eulalia works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase two boxes of fish to sell.
Eulalia has been a member of PMPC since 2011. In the future, Eulalia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase two boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rosa Amelia Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa su negocio es destace de cerdo y venta de nacatamales  desde hace 6 años es casada y tiene una hija le ayuda en el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cerdo en pie para el destace, Fabiola vende ropa y zapatos y Mariela vende ropa y zapatos.
texts.en: This is a group of three enterprising women. One of them is Rosa. For the past six years she has been in the business of slaughtering pigs and selling nacatamales. She is married and has a daughter who helps her in the business. She will use this loan to buy a live pig to slaughter. Fabiola and Mariela sell clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to invest money into the purchase of a live pig to slaughter.

loans.name: Amen 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AMEN 2 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des co-épouses. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Tien est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Tien n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Tien est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Tien est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Chinan. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Tien  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Tien vend depuis dix ans du mais, de la farine de manioc et des condiments à son domicile et de façon ambulante. Tien s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Tien sollicite pour une cinquième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursées.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, de la farine de manioc et des condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PARA TRATAMIENTO OFTALMICO

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Merania would like to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Abbasov

texts.en: A. is Internally Displace Person from the Aremenian-occupied Fizuli region of Azerbaijan. He and his family of his wife and four children were relocated to Beylagan region. As they were traditionally engaged in cattle breeding, he started this business in Beylagan since 2003. At that time he borrowed $400 from Normicro Beylagan branch to buy calves. Later he borrowed $600, $900 and finally $1000. He has good repayment history. NOw he applies for $1200 to buy more cows and expand the business.

loans.use: To buy two more cows

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Mrs K. Adjo was born in 1977 in Tsévié. Giving up her studies because of a lack of support, she started a business selling bread by the roadside. Very courageous, she is very rigorous in the management of her business. That has allowed her to repay her first loan, despite having the responsibility for her two children. She is now asking for a new loan of $800 that will allow her to build-up her business and participate more in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Adjo est née en 1977 à Tsévié. Abandonnant ses études, elle se lance dans le commerce, la vente du pain aux abords de la route par manque de support. Très courageuse, elle fait une gestion rigoureuse de ses activités ce qui lui a permis de rembourser son premier crédit malgré les charges de ses deux enfants. Elle sollicite de nouveau, un crédit de $800 qui servira au renforcement de son commerce afin de mieux participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: sale of bread

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr:
Kafui L., age 25, is married and the mother of two. She is a beautician by training. But without the means to open her own shop, she started selling beauty products. Despite insufficient revenues, she is making sure that her sister goes to school and that her mother's needs are met. Conscious of this responsibility, she works incessantly to meet the expectations of her customers. Today, facing the demand for new products, she realized that it would be profitable to include her skills with her business. To do so, she would like to buy some new products to sell and also certain supplies. And so she is requesting a loan of $1000 that will allow her to buy the necessary items. This would increase her income in order to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 25 ans Madame L. Kafui est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants, elle est esthéticienne de formation. N’ayant pas les moyens pour ouvrir son propre atelier, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des produits de beauté. Malgré l’insuffisance de son revenu, elle assure la scolarité de sa petite sœur et la charge de sa mère. Conscient de cette responsabilité, elle travail sans relâche pour satisfaire ses clients. Aujourd’hui face à la demande de nouveaux produits, Madame Kafui s’est rendue compte qu’il serait rentable d’associer son métier à sa marchandise. A cet effet, elle désir acheter certains matériels de travail et de nouveaux produits pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $1000 qui va lui permettre d’acheter le matériel nécessaire. Cela augmenterait son revenu pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire supplies to open a hairdressing and beauty salon

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A.’s husband, Tita Zacharia has been sick for a long time and she has spent the little money she had trying to get him cured to no avail.  Presently, she is the sole provider for her six children and her husband.  As a hard working woman, she grates cassava and fries it to get what is locally called "garri", which she then sells in wholesale and retail.  Garri is consumed either with soup or in cold water with sugar added.

With a loan of $300, she plans to increase the garri quantity she produces so she can have more income.  The profit will be used to buy food for her family and to pay school fees for her children.

She plans to repay her loan in 18 months.  Her first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Production and sale of Garri

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Her husband passed away a few years ago. Ms Ngô Thị Lợi, 48 years old, has been raising her 2 children by herself and now they are all grown up. She joined TYM fund in 1995, her first loan was only 30 USD which was invested in a morning breakfast service. In subsequent loans, she has been able to qualify for maximum amount which was invested in a clothing store. The investment has been fruitful. Now 12 years later, she has built a nice & cozy 60 m2 house (540 square feet). Her monthly income is about 187 USD. She's requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy more products for her breakfast service, winter clothes for her store for the coming cold season.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chồng mất từ mấy năm trước, chị Ngô Thị Lợi, 48 tuổi, một mình nuôi 2 con khôn lớn trưởng thành. Là thành viên tham gia Quỹ năm 1995, năm đầu chị vay vốn mức 30USD bán hàng ăn sáng. Các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị vay mức tối đa bán hàng quà và buôn bán quần áo mang lại những hiệu quả kinh tế tốt cho gia đình. Cho đến nay, sau 12 năm tham gia Quỹ chị đã xây nhà mới diện tích 60 m2 khang trang đẹp đẽ. Hiện tại mức thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng của chị Lợi là 187USD. Chị đang xin vay thêm 1200USD để mua thêm thực phẩm và quần áo rét bán cho mùa đông tới.

loans.use: Buy foodstuff, winter garment.

loans.name: María Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a very young entrepreneur that struggles to make a living.  A couple of months ago, she started a beauty salon with a friend’s help.  She runs the salon in a small, rented location.
Soledad needs funds to buy some materials.  With her loan she will buy a hair dryer, a used chair hair dryer and some hair brushes. 
Given this loan, the entrepreneur will able to support her university education in the capital.

loans.use: To purchase some materials for a small beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of materials.

loans.name: Djumankulov

texts.ru:
A. Djumankulov is 55 years old, married and has 6 children. Since his childhood he has been raising and fattening cattle for sale. He is also a skilled veterinary. Currently he has two cows with calves in his barn. His wife milks the cows and sells the milk at the market. After the calves are full grown, A. sells the cows and buys new animals, while leaving the calves for fattening. He is planning to buy two additional cows and has turned to Microinvest for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Чуманкулов Абдухамит,возрост 55 лет имеет,6 детей.Сдетства он занимается откормом и уходом за скотом.Он сам также хороший ветеринар.Сейчас имеет дома две коровы с телятами.Его жена доит молоко и продает на базаре.Откормив теленка Абдухамит продает коровы и взамен покупает новые, а телята остаются до готовновти.Поэтому он хочет,купить еще две большие коровы.Для чего обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Fattening and sale of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in cell phone cards and improve his sales carts

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
