A. Isaac is a successful trader who sells used clothing. He is married and has 5 dependents. Business is good and he wants to increase sales.

He is asking for $525 to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Ferila

texts.en: Ferila A., 22, is married with 1 children.  She has 3 year(s) of experience in the Ice cake (Ice cream) / popcorn business. She sells to the villagers and public. 2 days per week. She has no previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).  SPBD loans are Ferila’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used strictly to operate the business.

loans.use: Purchase plastic cups, concentration, plastic papers and sugar.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora Luz runs a store selling frozen drinks. She is 40 years old and began the business many years ago, continuously inspired by her four children to work hard. Nora Luz would like to get ahead, and hopes that her business will become a well-known establishment with a large customer base. In order to achieve this, Nora Luz needs the capital that will help her to quickly achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Nora Luz, tiene un negocio de venta de bebidas heladas se ha encaminado en esta actividad hace tiempos atrás y le va muy bien, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 04 hijos los cuales la inspiran a seguir adelante.La señora, Nora Luz, quiere surgir y salir adelante y con el tiempo espera que su negocio se convierta en un lugar conocido y de mucha concurrencia, para lograr este propósito necesariamente requiere de un capital que le ayudará a alcanzar su objetivo en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve her work space.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Born in 1982, Mrs. Massan K. was not successful in her studies due to the lack of financial support. She became involved with the making of cassava flour, “garri”, which is very well-liked in the area. Married to a tailor, she is the mother of three (3) children. She contributes to the costs of the household thanks to the income from her business. A very energetic woman, she manages her business very well and is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase large quantities of cassava. With this loan, she will be able to increase her income and thus better contribute to the improvement of her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1982, Madame K. Massan n’a pas fait de brillantes études par manque de support financier. Elle s’est lancée dans la fabrication de la farine de manioc « gari » qui est très appréciée dans le milieu. Mariée à un tailleur, elle est mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle contribue aux charges du foyer grâces aux revenus de son activité. Dynamique, elle gère bien ses activités et sollicite un financement qui va lui servir d’acheter en grande quantité le manioc. Par ce crédit, elle pourra augmenter son revenu pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: The purchase of cassava for processing into cassava flour

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr:
Yacine N. is a seamstress who was born in 1962 in Thies. She is married with three children and has opened her shop near the UIMCEC office in Thies. She has recruited two tailors who make women’s clothing and she is responsible for the sale of this clothing to her clients. In preparation for the religious holidays, she would like to increase her stock of cloth and sewing supplies.

Translated by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

yacine N. est une couturière née en 1962 à thies .elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants.elle a ouvert un atelier pres du bureau de UIMCEC DE THIES.elle a recruté deux tailleurs qui font de la confection d'habits de femmes et c'est elle qui est chargée de la revente à ses clients .c'est dans le but de préparer les fetes religieuses qu'elle veut renforcer ses stocks de tissus et de fournitures de couture.

loans.use: The sale of ready-to-wear women's clothing

loans.name: Fatou Kine

texts.fr: Fatou Kiné S. est une femme mariée agée de 42 ans.elle habite au quartier Cité Lamy et fait du commerce de depoissons secs, d'huile de palme etc ..depuis cinq ans. elles sollicite ce pret dans le but de renforcer son capital  .
texts.en:
Fatou Kiné S. is a married 42-year-old woman. She lives in the Cité Lamy district and has been doing commerce in dried fish, palm oil, etc. for five years. She is requesting this loan with the goal of bolstering her capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell food items

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Mrs. Lon Y. is a farmer in Ank Doung Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Y. is 31 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Aside from this business of farming, she also is a breeder who raises two pigs. Her husband, Mr. Phan Phat, is a fisherman. Even though they have different businesses, they still do not have enough money to build a new house so Mrs. Y. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house.

loans.use: Lon would like to add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Bahridin

texts.en: Bahridin is a hard working person who tries to provide the best for his 3 beloved children. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could develop it. He carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. For the past 4 years, he has gained experience in the purchase and sale of cattle which has brought stability to his family. He would now like to purchase more cattle that can create more income for his large family and is requesting 2100 Somoni ($625 USD) for the term of 12 months. Bahridin thanks you very much.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami M. is a married 42-year-old man with two children who has raised sheep and sold meat and wool to local people and livestock bazaars for the past eight years. The difficult circumstances and hardships in his life made Nizami recognize from a very young age the value of work, so every morning he arises early to feed his calves and cow with the goal of selling them at the best price in the local market when they have grown. Raising sheep is the main source of income for his family.

Nizami's primary goal is to provide an education for his children. With this purpose in mind, he has applied for a loan of $1200 to buy more sheep in order to expand his business. Let's support this hard-working man and hold our hands out to help him!

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep.

loans.name: Johari

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Johari J. M. from Dar es Salaam, the married mother of a nine-year-old child. Johari has been running a tailoring business since 2003. 

At her tailoring business she purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and makes them into clothing mainly for women.  She confided in us that what sets her tailoring business apart is that she is more skilled than others and is able to create different kinds of designs for her customers so they can stand out in a crowd. 

Working at the business 11 hours per day, 6 days per week, and assisted by her husband, Johari currently earns about $240 per month. She is now requesting a loan of $550 to purchase additional materials required for making clothes. In the future, she plans to carry a greater variety of materials in order to differentiate her products even further.  Johari thanks you for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase additional materials required for making clothes.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Миногова Назира жительница города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 45 лет, замужем и имеет троих детей. Имеет среднеспециальное образование. Работает медсестрой в поликлинике города. Кроме того имеет участок земли , которую засеивает пшеницей. Кредит планирует получить и использовать для покупки зерна. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nazira M. lives in the town of Tursun-Zade. She is 45 years old, married and has 3 children. She has college level education and works as a nurse at a clinic in town. In addition to the job she has a plot of land that she farms wheat on. Nazira plans to use the loan to buy wheat seed grain. She will repay her loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat  seed grain

loans.name: Bimkubwa

texts.en:
Bimkubwa has made a living selling juice in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for the last 20 years. She belongs to the Muungano loan group and currently earns an average profit of $50 a month. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is seeking her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy bread to sell to her customers. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Bimkubwa is 40 years old, married and has six children ages 7 to 20 years old.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Aom

texts.en:
Mrs. N., 32, lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia, where she has been a local farmer since 2007. She raises pigs and grows rice crops in the village, earning an average of $3 each day.

She is married to Mr. Sokha, 41, and they have no children. N.'s husband currently is an English teacher for the village pupils.

N. is asking for a loan as capital to buy more piglets to raise and will be using the remainder of the loan to run a little grocery store out of her house.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Omorotionwan

texts.en: Omorotionwan is a mechanic. He also sells motor spare parts and second hand cars. He lives in Benin city, Edo state, Nigeria. He hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. He is 39 years old and married without children. He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora, 48, is a sari-sari store (community-based store) owner in the village of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela, where she is married to Loreto, a farmer and a driver of a passenger tricycle in their village. The couple has three children: Brena, 31 years old, a college undergraduate and already married; Eveth, 30 years old, a Computer Science graduate working as an Overseas Filipino Worker in Taiwan, and the youngest, Loreto Jr., 25 years old, a high school graduate, now helping his father on their farm and with the tricycle operation. 

Aurora is requesting a loan of PHP 22,000.00 for the expansion of her business.  She plans to sell meat and other products that will cater to the needs of her customers and also buy more groceries for her store.  She is hoping for a continuous development in her business for the benefit of her family.  

Aurora is saving money for times of emergency and believes that with her dedication, she will somehow become successful, always keeping in mind the axiom, “Try and try until you succeed.”

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru:
Баходур  Якубов  мужчина 59 лет, проживает в городе Истаравшане. Женат на Гулбахор, имеет 2 детей. Основной его деятельностью является животноводство.Откармливает скот, перерабатывает молоко, и перепродает крупнорогатый скот на рынке Истаравшана.Место деятельности, его собственный дом.
 Баходур талантливый человек, дополнительный доход он получает от исскуства, которым он занимается на протяжении практически всей своей жизни.
texts.en:
Bahodur Y. is a 59-year-old man, who lives in the town of Istaravshan. He is married to Gulbahor and has two children. His main line of work is raising livestock. He fattens the cattle, processes the milk, and resells large-horned cattle at the Istaravshan market. He does all this at his house. Bahodur is a talented man, who earns extra income from the artwork in which he has engaged practically his entire life.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
K. Zuhro (husband pictured) is 36 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children.

Zuhro breeds cattle. She buys cattle in the market at low prices, feeds them and then resells them at the same market at a profitable price. Her husband also attends to the business. Zuhro works hard in order to make the business successful and she generates stable income for the family.

Zuhro is planning to purchase cattle for her household for raising and further selling. She requests $1000. Zuhro would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations or delinquency. ------------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle for selling.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita O., a 50-year-old resident of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a specialized retail business whose main revenue comes from selling various foods in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital and to partly pay for their purchase lot. This loan will be the third taken out by Nenita from HSPFI and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of the family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional working capital and to pay for their purchase lot

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expanding her inventory

loans.name: Choang

texts.en: Mrs. T. was born in 1979. She is a married woman and is the mother two school-aged children. She works in a handicrafts place making meatballs, for which she gets a daily income of $2 a day. Her husband owns a workshop where he repairs generators. He works very hard at his business, but he can’t sustain his business growth due to the lack of capital. T. has decided to seek a loan for her husband to purchase extra repair tools and to buy essentials spare parts to sell.

loans.use: To purchase tools and to buy essentials spare parts

loans.name: Genobeba

texts.en:
Señora Genobeba lives in the city of Pucallpa and dedicates herself to the sale of various products in the small communities along the Ucayali, a wide brown river that flows past the city and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.  Genobeba is pictured here with a sack of rice and another sack of staple food products.  Genobeba sells these items, as well as fuel.  She keeps her fuel supply stored in the community where her son works as a teacher.  This community is located on the Ucayali River one day and one night's travel by boat from Genobeba's home.  Genobeba considers herself to be an active woman and enjoys selling her products, especially in places located outside the city, both along the river or along the highway that joins Pucallpa and the capital, Lima.

Genobeba is 52 years old and is married with five children, only one of whom is still dependent on her.  Her husband works as a chainsaw operator for the Saenz Company.

Genobeba has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about two years and belongs to the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (New Friends).  She used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to invest in clothing and TVs, all of which were ordered in advance by residents of the town of Tournavista located two hours from Pucallpa.  Genobeba will use this loan of 1,500 soles to invest in two barrels of fuel and in other products which she plans to sell along the river.

Genobeba's goal is to eventually have a business out of her home; perhaps a restaurant.  Genobeba is happy to be working with Manuela Ramos and appreciates the facility with which the organization gives credit.  Other banks make obtaining loans much more difficult.

loans.use: Two barrels of fuel for sale; other staple food products for sale

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.en: Maria S. is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 39 years old and the mother of 5 children who all attend school. She is a strong businesswoman with a retail shop in Bugoba that she has owned 7 years. She is happy to be part of her lending group because she dreams of transforming her shop by stocking it with more goods for sale. The profits she makes enable her to save for her children’s education and the remainder is used for business recapitalization and family welfare. She needs a loan to help buy more goods for restocking her retail shop with sugar, salt, bread, cooking oil, and other items.

loans.use: To stock her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Madoty

texts.en: Madoty sells provisions, drinks and juice in her shop. Madoty is 50 and has 5 children. Madoty is very enthusiastic about the growth of her business and that of her family. She hopes for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and juice to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace N. is a 37-year-old business woman who has been in the clothing business for over six years. She has two children. She is using the loan to invest in her business by purchasing more stock of clothes. She wishes to work very hard to obtain a house in future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Imelda N.

texts.en:
Imelda hails from Nambale, Busia District, Kenya. She is 38 years old, married and the mother of 8 children. Before 2003, she was involved in the grocery business. She quit this and ventured into the cereals business. She buys her stock of cereals from Busia town twice a month and operates in two markets called Malanga and Nambale. Imelda believes in women's empowerment in entrepreneurship even though this is rare in her village.
Imelda requests a loan of Kshs. 10,000 to buy more cereals and expand her business. It is her dream to open a cereal storehouse in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more cereal and increase stock.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally N. lives in Ang Ta Kout village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on her own plot of land. She also breeders pigs. She wants to expand her pig raising business by purchasing ten piglets and pig food. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's lives with this loan. Em Sambath, Phally's husband is a teacher in a local school.  Phally is 45 years old and the mother of three children.  One is employed in a garment factory and the others attend school. Her husband is shown in the picture with Phally.

loans.use: Purchasing ten piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: El

texts.en:
Mr. El M., 60 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Slamas M., age 63, live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1978 and have ten children: three sons and seven daughters. Six of their children are married and live outside the family home, and other two are garment factory workers.

The couple are fisherfolk. In addition to fishing themselves, they buy fish from other fishermen and sell these on the other side of the Mekong River. Some of their fishing materials have worn down and no longer function properly, so Mr. El M. is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase new fishing materials to replace them.

loans.use: To purchase new fishing materials for his fishing business.

loans.name: Kalifa

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Kalifa Traoré a 26 ans, célibataire et père d’un garçon, il réside dans une  grande famille traditionnelle, avec ses parents et ses cadets à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Traoré est un électricien de profession, qui en parallèle avec sa profession, mène une activité d’achat et de vente des appareils électroniques (TV,Mine Chaîne, DVD, etc) à Mancourani I où se situe son atelier. 
Il mène cette activité depuis maintenant quatre ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses articles. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Le prêt précédent a été correctement. 
Il compte acheter, 3 DVD, 2 TV, 2 Mines Chaînes, 4 batteries, etc. Ses appareils proviennent de la république du Ghana.
 Monsieur Traoré  vend ses appareils (TV, Mines Chaînes, DVD, batteries, etc) dans son atelier de réparation à ses clients composés généralement de ceux qui sollicitent ses services de réparations.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Kalifa Traoré is a 26-year-old, single father of one son. He lives with a large traditional family, with his parents and his younger siblings in Kaboïla II, the central town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mr. Traoré is a professional electrician who also buys and sells electronic appliances (TVs, Mine Chaîne, DVDs, etc.) in Mancourani I where his shop is located. He has done this for four years now. He is often praised by his clients for the quality of his products. In order to meet the growing demands of his customers, he decided to rejoin the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for his second individual loan. He repaid his previous loan. He plans to buy 3 DVDs, 2 TVs, 2 Mine Chaînes, 4 batteries, etc. This equipment comes from the Republic of Ghana. Mr. Traoré sells his equipment in his repair shop to clients generally made up of those who solicit his repair services. He plans to make a monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA which he will use to increase his working capital, help with his family's expenses, repay the interest on the loan, and invest the rest in his work.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Electronic Equipment (TV,Mine Chaîne, DVD, etc).

loans.name: The Fighters Of Masisea Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Las Luchadoras de Masisea” tiene cuatro meses de haberse formado, son del distrito de Masisea, región de Ucayali, esta conformado por 16 socias, todas mujeres emprendedoras y muy trabajadoras, con el anhelo de superarse cada día, que su economía crezca con el transcurrir del tiempo y ser mujeres con mucha capacidad de desarrollarse laboralmente.
Ellas requieren un préstamo de 7,000 soles, para seguir dedicándose a diferentes actividades como son: venta de comidas típicas, lencería , confecciones, abarrotes, juguería, verduras y venta de gaseosas. Milusca es L. presidenta de este Banco Comunal, elL. es una mujer activa y colaboradora, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, uno de ellos mayor de edad. Milusca se dedica a L. venta de comida durante el día, esta actividad L. realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él es agricultor, el primer crédito que recibió Milusca fue de 300 soles, que lo utilizó en L. compra de productos para su negocio. L.  meta de Milusca, como de las demás socias, es poder crecer en su negocio y seguir apoyando en los gastos económicos del hogar.
texts.en:
The Community Bank “The Fighters of Masisea” was formed four months ago. It is made up of 16 members from the district of Masisea in the Ucayali region of Peru. All of these women are enterprising and hard-working. They hope to do better each day, to see their finances grow over time, and to be women with a great capacity for developing work skills. They need a loan of 7000 soles in order to continue working in various jobs, such as the sale of regional foods, linen goods, groceries, vegetables, sodas and juices, and dressmaking. Milusca is the president of the Community Bank. She is an active and contributing woman who is 44 years old. She is the mother of two sons, one of them an adult. Milusca sells food during the day, working from her house. She has the support of her husband, who is a farmer. The first loan that Milusca received was for 300 soles, which she used to buy products for her business. Milusca’s goal, like those of the rest of the members of the bank, is to be able to grow in her business and continue to help with the expenses in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They will use the loan to continue working in various jobs, such as the sale of regional foods, linen goods, groceries, vegetables, sodas and juices, and dressmaking.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desde hace 6 años, vive en el distrito de Chucuito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa.  Ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías y también vende artículos para el hogar.

Rosa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más productos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar bayeta y lana al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y los temas educativos que imparten las promotoras.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the Santa Bárbara Communal Bank for six years. She lives in the Chucuito district, Puno province and department. She is a 34 year old single mother, and she has two children. She has an elementary school education. She sells handicrafts, and she also sells items for the home. Rosa tells us that with her first loan for 300 PEN from the Manuela Ramos Movement she increased her capital and bought more products. She is asking for a loan for 500 PEN to buy wholesale material and wool. Her dream for the future is to have her own house and that her children become professionals. What she likes best about her Communal Bank are the savings and the educational talks given by the loan officers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and wool

loans.name: Limasene

texts.en:
Limasene S. is 25 and married with 2 children (ages 3-months and 5 years).  She owns a business venture, selling general handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Limasene has 6 years of experience in this business.  Limasene needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase additional handicrafts to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 180 tala or US $75 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Limasene joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Limasene's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Limasene S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.35 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Sieng's Group

texts.en:
Sieng S. sells a few vegetables that she buys from her wholesale supplier. She was born in 1963 and has been married for many years to Mr. Chin Reth, age 48. Her husband is a construction foreman. Together they make $7 per day. This couple has three young children who are studying and dependent on their income. Sieng S. is taking out her loan in order to earn extra income by purchasing secondhand clothes to sell at the market. 

This group loan has been applied for by three low-income people. Mrs. Sieng S. has been promoted by the other members of the group to be the leader. The other borrowers are: C., a fruit seller, who requests a loan to buy a motorcycle; and R., who works in construction and needs a loan to buy more building materials.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Juana V. quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
La mujeres de este grupo se organizaron y realizaron varias actividades para consolidar el grupo, y actualmente todas cuentan con su negocio o actividad que le genere ingreso.

La sra. Gasparina R. Mirandas es artesana en sombreros de karanday, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( karanday, cintas, cuero, etc), logrando de ese modo ofrecer una buena variedad de sombreros a sus clientes.

La sra. Maria Gloria V. se dedica a la artesanía de karanday, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( karanday, cintas, pegamentos, etc), logrando de ese modo obtener mayor variedad de trabajos en karanday  para a ofrecer a su clientela.

La sra. Liz Nathalia V. se dedica a la venta de Joyas de plata, invirtió el dinero en la compra de joyas de plata en general, obteniendo así mayor variedad de Joyas de plata que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La sra. Juana V. se dedica al trabajo en artesanía de karanday invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( hilo, cueros, karanday, ect), logrando de ese  modo ofrecer buena variedad de mercaderías a su clientela.

La sra. Fidelina Ortiz se dedica a la venta de remedio refrescante                , invirtió el dinero en la compra de los remedios refrescantes y  elementos para su trabajo, logrando ofrecer variedad y calidad de remedio refrescante que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La sra. Angela B. se dedica a la venta de remedio refrescante, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo, logrando de ese modo ofrecer buena variedad de remedios refrescantes a sus clientes. 

La sra. Norma Estela P. se dedica a la costura, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( tela , hilos, goma), ofreciendo así un buenas prendas de vestir a sus clientes.

La sra. Simeona B. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestibles, logrando ofrecer calidad y variedad de minutas a su clientela.

La sra. Clara Manuela M. se dedica a la artesnía en karanday, invirtió el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo ( karanday, cueros, pegamentos, etc), logrando ofrecer buenos trabajos para sus clientes.

La sra. Pelagia Bogadoposee una despensa, invirtio el dinero en la compra de mercaderías en general (embutidos, lácteos, bebidas, panificados), logrando así  ofrecer buena variedad de mercaderías  a sus clientes.

La sra. Catalina J. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestible, logrando de eso modo ofrecer variadas minutas a sus clientes.

La sra. Nicolaza Elizabeth O. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestible, logrando ofreciendo  calidad y variedad de minutas a su clientela.

La sra. Limpia Carolina V. se dedica a la artesanía en karanday, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( karanday, cueros),logrando ofrecer una  buena variedad de trabajos en karanday a sus clientes.

La sra. Jorgelina R. se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, invirtió el  dinero en la compra de prendas de vestir en general, logrando de ese modo ofrecer buena variedad de prendas de vestir a sus clientes.

La sra. Ana Maria C. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestibles, logrando así ofrecer una buena variedad de minutas a sus clientes. 

La sra. Evarista I.  Riveros se dedica a la artesanía en karanday , invirtió el dinero compra de materiales para su trabajo ( karanday, hilo, cuero) logrando de ese modo ofrecer buena variedad de trabajo en karanday a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The point person who started this committee was señora Juana V., who invited and organized her friends to start the program Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women). The women of this group organized and carried out various activities to consolidate the group, and currently all of them have businesses or activities that generate income. Sra. Gasparina R. Mirandas is an artisan who makes karanday (a plant native to Paraguay) hats. She invested the money in the purchase of supplies for her craft (karanday, belts, leather etc.), thus being able to offer a considerable variety of hats to her customers. Sra. Maria Gloria V. makes her living in the artisasnship of karanday (a plant native to Paraguay). She invested the money in the purchase of supplies for her craft (karanday, belts, adhesives etc.) thus being able to obtain a greater variety of works in karanday to offer to her customers. Sra. Liz Nathalia V. makes her living selling silver jewelery. She invested the money in the general purchase of silver jewelery, thus obtaining a greater variety of silver jewelery to offer to her customers. Sra. Juana V. makes her living working in the artisanship of karanday (a plant native to Paraguary). She invested the money in the purchase of supplies for her craft (thread, leather, karanday etc.) thus being able to offer a considerable variety of merchandise to her customers. Sra. Fidelina Ortiz makes her living selling herbal remedies. She invested the money in the purchase of herbal remedies and supplies for her business, thus being able to offer a variety of quality herbal remedies to her customers. Sra. Angela B. makes her living selling herbal remedies. She invested the money in the purchase of supplies for her business, thus being able to offer a considerable variety of herbal remedies to her customers. Sra. Norma Estela P. makes her living as a seamstress. She invested the money in the purchase of supplies for her business (fabric, thread, adhesives) thus being able to offer quality garments to her customers. Sra. Simeona B. makes her living selling food. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients for making her dishes, allowing her to offer a variety of quality snacks to her customers. Sra. Clara Manuela M. makes her living in the artisanship of karanday (a native plant of Paraguay). She invested the money in the purchase of materials for her craft (karanday, leather, adhesives etc.) allowing her to offer quality works to her customers. Sra. Pelagia B. owns a grocery. She invested the money in the purchase of general merchandise (cold measts, dairy products, beverages, bakery products) thus allowing her to offer a considerable vareity of merchandise to her customers. Sra. Catalina J. makes her living selling food. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients to make her dishes, thus allowing her to offer a variety of snacks to her customers. Sra. Nicolaza Elizabeth O. makes her living selling food. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients to make her dishes, allowing her to offer a variety of quality snacks to her customers. Sra. Limpia Carolina V. makes her living in the artinsanship of karanday (a plant native to Paraguay). She invested the money in the purchase of supplies for her craft (karanday, leather), allowing her to offer a considerable variety of karanday works to her customers. Sra. Jorgelina R. makes her living selling clothing. She invested the money in the purchase of general garments, thus being able to offer a considerable variety of clothing to her customers. Sra. Ana Maria C. makes her living selling food. She invested the money in teh purchase of ingredients to make her dishes, thus allowing her to offer a considerable variety of snacks to her customers. Sra. Evarista I. Riveros makes in living in the artisanship of karanday (a plant native to Paraguay). She invested the money in the purchase of supplies for her craft (karanday, thread, leather) thus being able to offer a considerable variety of works in karanday to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for work, belts, leather.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 44 years old and married with three children. She is a dairy and crops farmer which she has been doing for many years. She sells her farm produce to wholesalers who later sell to the small-scale traders. She also sells milk to her neighbors and retailers where she lives. Her husband, John, is also a farmer and they live in the same area, which is on the outskirts of Nairobi town. 

Hannah was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be her first loan. She has had no previous credit history with other microfinance institutions before joining KADET. She wants to use the money from this loan to buy fertilizers, seedlings and manure for the farm so that her output can increase. 

Hannah wants to be a leader in farm produce and dairy farming. This will improve their living standards and she will be able to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more seedlings, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
I. Mutabar is 46 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two adult children. Mutabar has been running her business for about 14 years. She sells clothes for teenagers and men. Her trading place is located in the local market. Mutabar has taken out several loans from IMON and has proven herself as a reliable client. Today she requests $1500 US Dollars. She is planning to enlarge the range of goods she is selling. Mutabar thanks everyone supporting her and promises to manage the loan as accurately as usual.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu A. is currently in the business of operating a pharmacy and is requesting a loan to stock more drugs to sell.  Dudu is 39 years old and is married to a husband that is a nurse. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more drugs to sell

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 40 years old and married with two children aged 14 years and 10 years. Both of them are attending school. Duncan is a dedicated farmer from Kipsomba Location in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has been in the farming business for 10 years, selling his milk and maize at the Kenya Cooperative Cremeries and National Cereals and Produce Board respectively. He also earns some income from his large-scale poultry project after resigning from a security firm. 

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kshs 36,400 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. In the future he intends to open up an Agrovet in which he will be selling poultry and dairy feeds in his own building. He is grateful for having joined a vibrant group that enables members to stimulate each other economically.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA PAULINA ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA, YA TRABAJA CON LA INSTITUCION HACE VARIOS AÑOS ES MUY RESPONSABLE EN EL PAGO D. SUS CUOTAS, ELLA ES DENOMINADA MAÑANERA YA QUE VEND. SUS PRODUCTOS DESD. TEMPRANAS HORAS D. LA MADRUGADA AL MAYOR Y AL MENOR EN UN MERCADO CON MUCHO MOVIMIENTO D. NUESTRA CIUDAD POR LA CALLE TUMUSLA, LAS MAÑANERAS SON UN GRUPO D. PERSONAS COMO SU NOMBRE LO INDICA VENDEN DESD. TEMPRANAS HORAS D. LA MADRUGADA PERO VENDEN PRODUCTOS POR MAYOR YA QUE EN LA MAYORIA D. LOS CASOS ELLAS LOS CONFECCIONAN SOLO VENDEN HASTA LAS 9 D. LA MAÑANA DESPUES LAS DESALOJAN YA QUE DOND. VENDEN NO SON SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA Y A LAS NUEVE EMPIEZAN A LLEGAR LAS DUEÑAS D. LOS PUESTOS, ELLA SOLO TRABAJA POR LAS MAÑANAS Y EN LAS TARDES SE DEDICA A LABORES D. CASA Y  COCINAR PARA  SU ESPOSO QUIEN LLEGA CANSADO TRAS UNA JORNADA LARGA D. TAXISTA. SE AYUDAN AMBOS YA QUE SUS HIJOS SON MAYORES Y VIVEN D. MANERA INDEPENDIENTE. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Paulina is a long-time Emprender customer, she has worked with the institution for many years and is very responsible in making her payments. She is called "morning person" as she sells her products both wholesale and retail early in the morning in a heavily trafficked market on Tumusla street. The "morning people" are a group of people who, as their name says, sell their goods early in the morning. They sell their goods wholesale since in most cases, they make their products and only sell until 9 am. After 9, the owners of the stores arrive and the "morning people" have to leave. Paulina only works in the morning but in the afternoon she takes care of her home and cooks for her husband who arrives tired after a long day of being a taxi driver. They help each other since their children are older and live indepedently. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for showing confidence in her by providing her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José P. C., vive con su compañera de vida en el Barrio de Planes de Arenal, tiene la edad de 49 años, su esposa labora como doméstica, sin embargo en los tiempos libre le apoya a su esposo quien es agrícola, sembrador de yuca desde hace 31 años. Ellos son una familia de 5 hijos, dos de ellos son casados y los menores estudian la escuela secundaria.

Dentro de los planes a futuro está la diversificación de los cultivos, debido a que existen cultivos que se consumen en masa y desean aprovechar el consumo, por este proyecto es que solicitan un préstamo para la preparación de los terrenos,  el crédito lo solicitan para la compra de materiales agrícolas tales como fertilizantes, pesticidas, insumos vegetativos y compra de semillas, este préstamo los preparara a futuro para la inclusión de nueva producción que los favorezca económicamente y aporte a las condiciones de habitad de la familia.
texts.en:
José P. C., 49, lives with his life partner in Planes de Arenal neighborhood; his wife is a domestic employee and helps her husband with his farming chores in her spare time. He has been a manioc farmer for 31 years. They have five children, two of whom are married; the younger ones are in secondary school. Among his plans for the future is crop diversification because there are certain crops that are mass consumed and they want to take advantage of this. They are asking for funds for this project to prepare the fields. They need to buy fertilizers, pesticides, farming supplies and seed. This loan will set them up to include new production in the future that will be of economic benefit to them and contribute to improved living conditions for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
Mr. Rithy P. is 30 years old and is a villager who lives in Thmei village, Kandal province. He is a farmer and also a motorbike repairer who is able to earn a small income to support his family. His wife raises pigs at home and she is shown with him in the photo.

In order to support his wife’s business, Mr. Rithy P. decided to ask for a loan to buy six piglets and pig feed and to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support his farm crops.

This couple has three children: two are attending the local school while the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy six piglets and pig feed plus fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Muharam

texts.en:
Muharam is married and has one child. She has a business selling clothing in the small market of Tursunzade. 

Muharam’s business is going well as demand has been very stable over the last 12 years. Muharam is an entrepreneur of high integrity. She is very hard working and energetic. Even when her competitors have similar product or lower prices, clients naturally gravitate to her as she can skillfully make them feel valued, respected and heard. 

Muharam is requesting a loan of 7,000 Somoni to purchase seasonal clothing which will help her to continue stabilizing her business and income so she can support herself and her daughter.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for women for the summer season.

loans.name: Charina

texts.en: Charina A. is from the village of Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 26 years old. Charina is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Charina operates a restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving local foods to customers in the local community. Charina has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Charina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charina has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Charina is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Charina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna C. is from the village of Olango. She is 50 years old. Lorna is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna raises livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lorna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Lorna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora P. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Lakdon, Balamban, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a vegetable vending business.  Her husband, Maximo P., who is 63 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 5 children, ages 22 to 34 years old.

Teodora joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teodora has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 8th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10000, which she intends to use to purchase a bigger volume of vegetables to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future. She plans to use the profits for house improvements. Teodora P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old and is married with one child.

In 2003 he opened a food market in a residential area where demand is high. His reputation in his local community is good.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 from Kiva partner, CHF-ACSI which he wants to invest in increasing his stock and installing roll shutters for his shop entrance. He is planning to add new and different products in the future.

loans.use: To increase his stock and to install roll shutters for his shop entrance

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.ar: المقترضة 36 سنة متزوجة ولها خمسة اطفال، المقترضة انهت الدراسة الابتدائية، لقد تقدمت المقترضة بطلب قرض والغرض منه لتطوير صالون التجميل ولشراء كراسي جديدة للحلاقة ومواد تجميل، للمقترضة خبرية طويلة في هذا المجال بحدود 8 سنوات ، يأتي للمقترضة اعداد كبيرة من النساء بسبب خبرتها وبسبب موديلات الحلاقة الحديثة التي تتبعها، وسيساعدها هذا القرض على تطوير الصالون وهذا سيؤدي الى زيادة دخلها، وتنوي ايضا جلب عاملة اضافية تساعدها في العمل.
texts.en:
The applicant is 36 years old, married, and the mother of five children, with a primary school education. The applicant is seeking a loan to hire an assistant and purchase new hairdresser chairs and cosmetic products among other things for the renovation of her beauty salon. Her considerable expertise (cultivated from eight years of working in hairdressing) and her skills in making up the latest coiffures have already drawn in large numbers of female clients. These renovations will help to increase her revenues.

Translated from Arabic by John Halliwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and new hairdresser chairs

loans.name: María Irma

texts.es:
María Irma es una joven madre de familia que tiene 23 años de edad, reside junto a su familia en el caserío Huaca de Barro, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope, a mas de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la comercialización de animales menores, ella cría animales en la casa donde reside y los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente comercializa granos como por ejemplo maíz. Ella compra estos productos a los agricultores de la zona durante las temporadas de cosecha para revenderlos a los mismos negociantes que le compran los animales.

María Irma y su familia no cuentan con una casa propia, construir su casa propia se ha convertido en uno de sus anhelos mas esperados y para lograrlo ella y su esposo se han esforzado mucho durante el tiempo que llevan juntos. Actualmente cuentan con algunos materiales pero aun les hace falta comprar cosas, por este motivo María Irma se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante luchadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran honrada y amable, en la imagen nos muestra la construcción de su vivienda que planea terminar gracias al préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
María Irma is a young 23-year-old mother. She lives with her family in the Huaca de Barro area, an agricultural zone located in the district of Mórrope, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has worked selling young animals for more than a year. She raises the animals in the house where she lives and feeds them grains and natural grasses. When they reach a good level of development, she sells them to merchants that always visit the area where she lives. María Irma also sells grains such as corn. She purchases the grains from area farmers during the harvest season to re-sell them to the same merchants that buy the animals from her.

María Irma and her family do not have their own house. Building a house has been one of her most awaited dreams and in order to be able to do it, she and her husband have put in a lot of effort during the time that they have been together. They currently have some of the materials but they still need to buy things. This is why María Irma has seen it necessary to request a 1500 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa. This will be her first loan.

She is a fighter and has a lot of desire to get ahead. The people that know her consider her to be honest and friendly. In the photo, she shows us the construction of her house that she plans to finish thanks to the loan requested.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to finish building her house.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita O. is a married woman who lives in Purok Roadside, Pta. Salong, Manapla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  Hog Raising and Food Vending businesses. Her husband Rodney, who is 44 years old, works as a electrician to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is 13 years old. 

Nelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use to purchase  feed for her piggery so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. 

Nelita O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El señor Aníbal O. tiene 40 años de edad, está casado desde hace mucho tiempo con la señora Basilia Nuñez y tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar que aun dependen económicamente de ellos. Viven en su propia casa que está situada en Barrio Jardín San Miguel.

El señor Anibal es propietario de un local de venta de bebidas y comidas rápidas tales como empanadas, sándwich, croquetas y otros, además el es entrenador deportivo y constantemente trabaja con la liga encarnacena de futbol. Cuando el no está el negocio es atendido por su esposa quien es la encargada de cocinar las minutas. Gracias a esta actividad ellos pueden mantener su hogar, solventar los gastos diarios, educar a sus hijos y cubrir cualquier imprevisto que se les presente.

Ellos han solicitado este crédito para la compra de más insumos para comidas y también bebidas.
texts.en:
Aníbal O., age 40, has been married to Basilia Nuñez for a long time.  They have three school age children who are still dependent upon them.  They live in their own house in the Jardín San Miguel neighborhood.

Anibal is the proprietor of a place that sells drinks and fast-food like empanadas, sandwiches, croquettes, and other items.  He is also a sports trainer, and he regularly works with the Encarnacena soccer league.  When he is not at his business, his wife takes care of it and cooks the fast-food.  

Thanks to this business, they are able to support their household, pay the daily expenses, educate their children, and cover whatever unforeseen expense presents itself.

They are requesting this loan to buy more supplies for food, and they will also buy drinks.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food and also to buy drinks

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Roberto A. de 30 años, está soltero,  tienen la dicha de tener 1 hija, que está viviendo con su  madre actualmente.
   Roberto se dedica a este trabajo hace más de  8 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2.002; el comenzó desde muy chico a trabajar en relojería y joyería, con su padre en su negocio, con quien aprendió el oficio, que después de un tiempo considerado su papá le dio para su capital, y habilitó un local, que con el tiempo fue encontrando espacio y confiabilidad en la sociedad, en la actualidad el tiene mucha gente que concurre a su local.
   El utilizaría este crédito en comprar mercaderías como: relojes, cadenas, pulseras,tobilleras, otras.
texts.en:
Roberto A. is 30 years old.  He is single and has the good fortune to have 1 daughter, who is currently living with her mother.

Roberto has been in this business for more than 8 years, since approximately 2002.  He started working in the watch and jewelry business from an early age, alongside his father in his business.  It is his father who taught him the trade.  After a while his father gave him some capital and he fitted out his premises.  He currently has a lot of people who come to his premises.

He will use this loan to buy merchandise such as: watches, chains, bracelets, anklets, etc.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise (watches, chains, bracelets, anklets, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock beans and more onions to sell

loans.name: Jinja Tweyambe Group-Jinja

texts.en:
David W. is 45 years old and is the happily married father of ten. For the last 31 years, he has been selling cattle and goats in Ivunamba-Jinja. He inherited his business from his late father. He also is a farmer. David estimates that he makes as much as 80,000 UGX each week, depending on the number of cows he sells. 

David belongs to the Jinja Tweyambe Group and will use his portion of this loan to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Assylyn

texts.en:
Assylyn D. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 48 years old. Assylyn is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Assylyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Assylyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Assylyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Assylyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Assylyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Assylyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as junk foods

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Set

texts.en:
Set S. is 39-year-old married woman. She lives with other family members in her own small home in Kompong Cham province. Set S. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on her land, such as rice and morning glories, and she gets good results from her planting in both rainy and dry seasons. Her husband also helps her in the farming business.

The couple is married and has five children; four are single and one is married. They have two children employed in a garment factory who receive a regular salary every month and share their profit to support the whole family. However, they have no motorbike to get to work and hire a motor taxi driver every day. To reduce this travel expense, Set S. is requesting a loan for her children to purchase a used motorcycle to drive to work. Set S. and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for driving to work

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 60 years old. Elsa is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Elsa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas C., 56, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on his own land for many years. He is married to Ran, age 53, who assists him in the farming business. In addition, his wife also raises a few pigs in a stall at their home. The family typically generates a profit of around $4.60 per day. 

The couple is blessed with five children; three are single, and two are married. Two of the children are employed as sewing workers at a garment factory, where they earn a formal salary every month.

 Because his farm lacks a watering system, Meas C. would like a loan to buy an irrigation pump.

loans.use: To buy an irrigation pump

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato A. is from the village of Captain Vicente Roa Street, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 44 years old. Renato is separated from his spouse and has four adult children. To make a living, Renato owns & operates a business venture buying and selling car & motorcycle parts & accessories in the local community. Renato has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Renato joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renato has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Renato is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like motor and car parts. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Renato from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like motor and car parts

location.town: Capt. Vicente Roa St., Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Florence Wambui

texts.en:
Florence, who has practised tailoring in Olkalou town for the last 10 years, is 39 years old, married to John N., and the mother of one child. Florence was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field staff, and this will be her first loan with which she plans to buy more cloth material and a modern sewing machine.

In the future, Florence hopes to grow her business and clientelle to become a leading tailor in Olkalou.

loans.use: To buy more cloth material fand a modern sewing machine for making dresses

loans.name: Juicy

texts.en: Juicy is a 39-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a sari-sari store, fish vending and food vending businesses. She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store, fish vending and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Juicy is borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Juicy aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guillermina; ella tiene 64 años de edad y es casada y tiene 9 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras y flores, la socia lleva a la ciudad de Cusco y lo vende en el mercado de Huancaro, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras y flores. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como tomates, cebollas, habas, pepinos y zanahorias y también para comprar flores.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 64 years old, married, and has nine children. Guillermina divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling vegetables and flowers. She leaves the city of Cusco so that she can sell at the market in Huancaro. Guillermina works from 8am to 4pm. She wants to improve and expand her vegetable and flower business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, beans, cucumbers, and carrots. She will also buy flowers.

Guillermina is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and flowers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Grace W. G. has been supplying building materials to her customers in Mwiki town .She is 49 years old, widowed and a mother of four children. Her monthly income is KES.45,000.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, who is registered member with KADET, and she is applying for her first loan of KES.30,000 to buy more building stones for sale .The anticipated profit will be used to educate her children and expand her business by starting a milk bar.

In future she desires to grow her business and buy a deep freezer for the milk business.

loans.use: To buy building stones for resale.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María de Jesús de 44 años,  vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Su esposo es guardián de seguridad y tienen tres hijos mayores de edad. Ella tiene una pequeño negocio de costura y venta de comida.

Comenzó su actividad hace 5 años en la costura peri después inicio con otro nuevo que es en la venta de comida para mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Ella e la costura lo realiza en las mañanas junto con una vecina que la ayuda y en la tarde de dedica en las ventas de comidas.

Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar mas materiales como telas por variedad reatas por 40 unidades e hilos 100 docenas para su costuras,en un futuro desea incrementar su negocio y terminar de construir su casa para tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
