María de Jesús is 44 years old.  She lives in an exurb of Guayaquil in el Paraísol.  She lives in a cement house, but only has basic-service electricity.  Her husband is a security guard; they have three adult children.  She has a small business sewing and selling food.

She began her sewing five years ago, then started selling food to increase her income.  In the morning, she and a neighbor do the sewing, while in the afternoon, she sells food.

The loan will be used to buy materials, such as different fabrics and thread for her sewing business.  In the future, she hopes to increase her business and finish building her house so as to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Mrs. Met is a 40-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer since she was single. She is earning approximately of $2 a day from her farming business. Her husband is a local farmer also. The humble couple has only one child who is no longer in school and who is working with their businesses. 

This rainy season is coming now; the lakes are full of water and it is a good chance for Met to feed small fish in her pond but she lacks money to make it possible, Therefore, Met is applying for a loan to purchase some small fish for breeding purposes. With the rest of loan funds, she will buy some farming tools for her farming business. 

Note: Mrs. Met is in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase some small fish to raise and some farming tools.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a mother of 8 children between the ages of 1 to 16 years.  She sells cassava and she has done this for the past 2 years.  This business has enabled her to pay school fees for her children and to meet the needs of her family.

Hawa is very hard-working.  She is requesting a loan to buy more cassava for sale.  She plans to save all her profits and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy cassava for sale.

loans.name: Gary Zaldy

texts.en:
Gary Zaldy, age 34, has a retail shop where he sells dry goods. He has been in this business for almost 10 years. He and his wife have no children as yet.
 
Gary is asking for a loan of 40,000.00 PHP to be used in purchasing additional stocks of dry goods to offer for sale in his store. Each month, he earns about 8,000.00 PHP from his business.

In the future, Gary hopes to improve his business and start up another kind of business in the future. He believes that he will be able to achieve his business goal someday through the continuous support and assistance of those generous Kiva lenders who choose to support him.

loans.use: to purchase additional quantities of dry goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.  Hellen has a food stall where she sells yellow and sweet bananas.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days a week. She sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of yellow and sweet bananas. Her main business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goal for her business is to start getting her yellow bananas directly from farmers.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow and sweet bananas

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul, 53, is a member of this group of four. Her husband and their six children are from the small northern town of Tup. Both Aigul and her husband are farmers, and their younger children also get involved in seeding, watering and gathering their produce.

For Kyrgyz farmers there is much to gain from cultivating vegetables like potatoes, onions, carrots and cabbages, since these ingredients are much used in the local cuisine. Ten years ago with an initial investment of 3,000 KGS Aigul purchased potato seeds. Aigul has put a lot of effort into growing a rich harvest of the best sort of potatoes. However, expenses include not only the cost of seeds but also money for fuel, lubricants, equipment rental and fertilizers.

With her share of the loan Aigul plans to purchase pest killers and 300 liters of fuel to use on developing her fields. In the fall after gathering and selling her crops, Aigul plans to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase pest killers and 300 liters of fuel.

loans.name: Selene De Los Andes

texts.es: En el municipio de Ana virgen noble vive Selene tiene 26 años y tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene su pequeño local en sus casa en donde vende varias cosas como calzado, cosméticos, ropa y además en sus vitrinas exhibe joyas y zapatos de todo tipo, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 8 hasta las 6 de la tarde nos cuenta que le gusta su trabajo ya que además de ganarse lo necesario para sus gastos, este también le da el tiempo necesario cumplir con las exigencias que estos requieren. Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, zapatos, cosméticos. Sus metas son ampliar su negocio y su inventario.
texts.en: In the Ana Virgen municipality lives Selene. She is 26 and has one young child under her care. She sells general merchandise. She has a small store in her home where she sells various items such as shoes, cosmetics and clothing. In her display cases she has jewellery and all kinds of shoes. She works there every day from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm, and tells us that she likes her work because on top of earning enough to cover her costs, it also allows her the time to dedicate to household upkeep. This loan is for the purchase of pants, shirts, blouses, shirts and cosmetics. Her goals are to expand her business and her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, shoes, cosmetics.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman with four children. One of her children attends school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a poultry business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She has a charcoal selling business, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business. 

With the KSHS 80,000, she wants to purchase chicks and sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for rural electrification in her home. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and sacks of charcoal for resale and to pay for rural electrification in her home.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul de Mocambique, solteira e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais todos frequenta a escola. Fez a 10ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras, vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 
Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é cozinheira ha mais de 6 anos no intituto agrario de Boane e tem um salário de cerca de 5.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 18.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes, chapas, pranchas, ferro, pedra, e outros) para dar continuidade a sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 6.000.00mt, e 12.000.00mt ,também para habitação.
Pretende concluir a sua casa, e contruir uma mercearia para ampliar a sua actividade comercial, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Amelia was born in Boane, in the southern Mozambican province of Maputo. She is a single mother of 5 children who all attend school. Amelia attended school up to the 10th Grade but left owing to her financial circumstances. She lives in her own home with her family and does not support anyone else.
Amelia has never lived anywhere but her home town. She has worked as a cook for 6 years in the Boane Institute of Agriculture; she receives a monthly salary of around 5,500MTs which covers her household expenses and allows her to save a little in her Millennium BIM bank account.
She has never borrowed money from any other bank. She heard about Hluvuku through her friend who is also a Hluvuku client. This is Amelia's third loan with this institution, for 18,000MTs, which she will use to buy building materials (beams, sheeting, boards, iron, stone and other materials) so that she can continue with her project. Her previous loans were for 6,000MTs and 12,000MTs and were also used on her home.
Amelia wants to finish building her house and to expand her business by building a grocery shop. She intends to apply for further loans with Hluvuku for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy building materials (beams sheeting, boards, iron, stone and other materials).

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, tiene 34 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella tiene una tienda agro veterinaria. Ya son siete años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. 

Francisca requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería insecticidas y pesticidas. 

El Banco Comunal “Nueva Visión de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Urubamba (Cusco,  Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Francisca is 34 years old and in a common law marriage from which she has two children.  She has an agro-veterinary store.  She has had this business for seven years now, and it's going very well for her.

Francisca is requesting the loan to buy merchandise of insecticides and pesticides.

The Communal Bank “Nueva Visión de Urubamba”, ("New Vision of Urubamba"), meets monthly in Cusco, Peru.  Cusco is known for being an area with a lot of tourism and business, for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi, and because it's the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy merchandise of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Tica Tica, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cleofe;  la socia tiene 38 años de edad la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, la socia se dedica la compra y venta de ropa de manera independiente ella solo reparte a sus amistades y amigos cercanos y en algunas instituciones por medio de algún contacto, la socia desea invertir el crédito e la compra de ropa para damas y caballeros al por mayor la socia compraría chompas de cuello largo, polos, pantalones, camisas, vestidos y algunas casacas, La socia desearía tener una galería de ropa en un futuro cercano. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa al por mayor para la venta.
La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Communal Bank “MADRES TRABAJADORAS” ("The Hard-Working Mothers").  The bank is located in Tica Tica district, in Cusco Province in Cusco Department.

This member is Señor Cleofe.  She is 38 years old, and lives with her partner and 2 children aged 7 and 4.  The member works for herself, buying and selling clothes.  She sells only to nearby friends and acquaintances, and to several companies by means of her contacts.

The member wants to invest the loan in the purchase of women's and men's clothing at wholesale.  The member will buy high-necked sweaters, polo-shirts, trousers, blouses, dresses, and some jackets.  The member would like to have a clothing store in the near future.  The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of clothing at wholesale, which she will resell.

The member shows great satisfaction and appreciation for the support that is being offered to her through this means, and agrees to comply with the payment of her liabilities at the established location.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing at wholesale, which she will resell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 29 years old married to Angela who is a student and they are blessed with one child six months old. Moses sells mobile phone accessories in Kitengela; Nairobi, where most of his clients are both female and male.

He has been in this business for the last one year and gets an income of KES. 10,000 monthly. He has applied for  a loan of KES.30,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use KES.10,000 to purchase more mobile phone accessories,KES.10,000 calling cards and KES.10,000 purchase chargers for sale.

He will use the extra profit to pay fees and do masters.Moses hopes to own a cyber cafe. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more mobile accessories, calling cards and chargers.

loans.name: Bon Berger Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BON BERGER est composé de trois personnes qui se connaissent à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenus. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe,du nom de Esther est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Esther est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Esther est mariée à un secrétaire du nom de Salomon. Le couple à un enfant, scolarisé, et à leur charge.Esther vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant.Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Esther vend des boissons en canette et des savons.Esther s’approvisionne au Togo Etat voisin du voisin du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Esther sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BON BERGER un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Bon Berger Group ("the good shepherd") is composed of three people knowing one another through their business activities. This is the second time that the group members came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for financial assistance in order to raise their activity level.

The group is represented by Esther, who is pictured raising her hand. She is 36 years old and lives in Benin. Esther is married to Salomon, a secretary. They have one child, who attends school and is in their care. Esther lives with her husband and their child. In order to provide for her needs and those of her child, Esther sells canned beverages and soap. She gets her supplies in Togo, a country bordering on Benin. Eager to satisfy her clientele and increase her turnover and income, Esther joins the other members of Bon Berger Group and applies for a second loan.

loans.use: to buy canned beverages and soap.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a selling of sun-dried fish business in the Philippines. Gina has been in this business for 20 years. 
Gina earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more fish for her dried fish business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Sarah Mugure

texts.en: Sarah is a 31 year old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be friendly. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair and beauty services. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a shopping centre and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase more hair relaxers, shampoos and other cosmetics. Her business goal is to grow it into a spa within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a plot of land where she will build a residential home.

loans.use: to purchase hair relaxers, shampoos and other cosmetics

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррина замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Она работает преподавателям и одновременно занимается скотоводством. Она очень старательная и усердно работает. За последние 10 лет она окармливает скот и расширяет бизнес. В бизнесе ей помогает муж. От ранее полученных доходов она отремонтировала дом и улучшила условия дома. Теперь она хочет расширить бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль для того чтобы купить детям кровати. Она хотела бы получить займ для покупки 8 голов крупного рогатого скота. Она надеется на вашу поддержку, и заранее благодарна вам.
texts.en: Zarrina is married and a loving mother of two children. She works as a teacher and supplements her income by raising livestock. She is very diligent and works very hard. For the last 10 years she has been raising cattle and expanding her herd. Her husband helps her with this business. Using profits from her business she was able to repair their home and improve their living conditions. Now Zarrina would like to expand her herd so that she can use additional profits to buy her children new beds. She would like to take out a loan to purchase 8 heads of cattle and she is hoping for your support and would like to thank you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and is married with three children aged between 1 and 15 years old. Her business is well, clean, and good. She sells African clothes. She has 5 years of experience in this business and employs two people to help her. Her business starts from 7am until 6pm every day.

Rose has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company to purchase more African clothes to sell. With any profit from the loan, Rose will expand her business to save for her future and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase  more African clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ana Karina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bellavista de la Ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Banco Comunal Bellavista.

Aquí vive la señora Ana, tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres hijos, los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella además de ser una madre y esposa ejemplar trabaja como profesora contratada en una escuela de la localidad y además se dedica al comercio,  vende  zapatillas, ropa de mujer y además productos de Yanbal, (perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, también vende en la escuela donde trabaja, lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad y le  va muy bien.

Este crédito  lo va invertir en comprar ropa, zapatillas y cosméticos Yanbal. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante tanto en su trabajo como en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Bellavista neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the “Bellavista” communal bank meet every two weeks.

Ana, 33, lives here.  She’s married and has three children who attend secondary and elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Besides being an exemplary mother and wife, she also works as a contracted teacher at a local school and also is a merchant; she sells sandals, women’s clothing and Yanbal brand products (perfume, creams, cosmetics and other women’s accessories).  She sells door to door and on order; she also sells at the school where she works.  She’s been in business more than 10 years and she does very well.

She will use this loan to buy clothes, sandals and Yanbal brand cosmetics.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the benefits the institution provides.  Her dream is to continue forward both in her job and with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sandals and Yanbal brand cosmetics.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares who is a 42 year old man, married with three sons and two daughters, has a store for selling fruits and vegetables. He wants to purchase a bulk of fruits and vegetables to have a better collection in his store to resell and increase his income as it is the only source of income to the family. To ensure that his business is very successful, he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Fares gets the loan, he will purchase a bulk of fruits and vegetables to his store, so he will have a better collection and have the ability to satisfy costumer needs, his sales will increase and so will his income. This will enable Fares to offer better living conditions to his family. Fares is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a bulk of fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Alice Mawia

texts.en: Alice, 39 years old, is married and has five children ranging in age from three and sixteen years. She is a quiet and hardworking woman. For the last five years, she has involved herself in the charcoal selling business. In addition, she also does farming. Her business challenge is the shortage of charcoal for selling. She will use the loan of KES 15,000 to buy more charcoal. In the future, Alice hopes and dreams of being a supplier of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more charcaol.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married and has six children ranging from fifteen to twenty-six years. She describes herself as a sociable and friendly woman. She has been selling clothes for the last five years. In addition, she also does farming to add to her income. She describes her business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the clothing retail store. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy  more ladies' clothes. In the next five years, Josephine dreams of and plans to run a boutique near her town.

loans.use: To buy more ladies' clothes.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a petty trader. Some of the items she sells are fresh tomatoes, peppers, onions, palm oil, salted fish, tinned tomatoes, and other food items at Adum Banso near Takoradi.  She is married to a farmer and has five dependents.  Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their dependents.  

Ekua will use her loan to purchase fresh tomatoes, peppers, onions, salted fish, tinned tomatoes, and other food items for resale. With her new profit, Ama will expand Ekua business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh tomatoes, peppers, onions, salted fish, tinned tomatoes, and other food items for resale.

loans.name: Luis Arcenio

texts.es:
Luis es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Luis se ha dedicado a la actividad de la agricultura gran parte de su vida, y gracias a esta ha podido sacar a su familia adelante. Luis se encuentra casado y es padre de 2 hijos de 11 y 6 años de edad, a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una mejor educación. Luis tiene en su cultivo una gran variedad de productos, lo que le permite tener muy buenas ventas, sin embargo, debido a que cuenta con muy bajo capital, Luis requiere de la compra de algunos insumos para su cultivo a los que no ha podido acceder por sus propios medios. Es por esto que Luis busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de semillas, riegos, insecticidas y otros insumos que requiere para su cultivo.

Luis espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá atender más necesidades de sus clientes. Además, Luis espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y pueda cumplir el sueño de sus hijos de acceder a una educación de mejor calidad.

loans.use: Compra de semillas, riegos, insecticidas y otros insumos que requiere para su cultivo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PARA TRATAMIENTO OFTALMICO

loans.name: Mirtahir

texts.en:
You can see in the picture a very cheerful, polite, sociable and kind person. 
This young man was born in Salyan region Khaladj village in 1958.
He has a lot of plans in connecing with his business.
One day he decided  to begin  to be busy with trade. 
In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 and built a store. 
For the second time he borrowed a loan of $800 and bought food-stuffs 2 package sugar, 2 package granulaed sugar, tea, flour.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 o expand the area of his store and to buy food-stuffs.

loans.use: To expand he area of his store and o buy the food-suffs: sugar, tea and etc.

loans.name: Eyvazov

texts.en:
Parvis is a 26 year-old resident of Beylagan town. In 2006 he started the business of butchery and he rents a shop near marketplace. In 2006 he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed his first loan amounting to $750. He repaired the shop and bought sheep to slaughter. He wants to improve the quality of service and wants to buy a counter-refrigerator.
He is applying for $900 as his second loan.

loans.use: To buy a counter-refrigerator

loans.name: Sodalo

texts.fr:
Born in 1946 in Vogan in the Vo area, Mrs. Sodalo A. is a married mother of three (03) children. She buys and re-sells various food products. Her husband has been unemployed for a very long time; therefore, the entire family depends on her alone. Very concerned for the future of her children, she has never given up and always tries to do better. She is asking for a credit of $600 to build her business in order to provide for the family's needs. She is capable of using her credit to build and improve her business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1946 à Vogan dans la préfecture de Vo, Madame A. Sodalo est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de divers produits alimentaires. Son mari a perdu son emploi depuis très longtemps. C’est ainsi que toutes les charges de la famille reviennent à elle seule. Très soucieuse de l’avenir de ses enfants, elle n’a jamais baissé les bras, elle cherche toujours à faire mieux. Ayant l’idée maintenant de renforcer son activité, elle sollicite donc un crédit de $600 pour faire progresser cette activité génératrice de revenus enfin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle est apte à gérer son crédit et à mener au mieux son projet.

loans.use: Buying bags of rice, sugar and other staple foods

loans.name: Sokahoin

texts.fr:
Aged 40, Mrs. Sokahoin F. currently lives in Avégloédjigan where she was born. Married and the mother of six children, she is a fine woman who works hard for a living. A professional hairdresser, she has an associated business of selling hair accessories such as pomades, extensions, straightener and shampoo. She has come to realize that this business is very profitable and the income is of enormous support to her. To have a steady and regular income, she wants to set up a sales outlet where she can sell these products, especially hair extensions of all types. She is asking for a credit of $800. Realizing this project will enable her to be financially independent.

Agée de 40 ans, Madame F. Sokahoin réside actuellement à Avégloédjigan où elle est née. Mariée et mère e six (6) enfants, elle est une brave dame qui se bat pour son pain quotidien. Coiffeuse de profession, elle a associé à son activité la vente de produits accessoires de coiffure comme des pommades, des mèches, du défrisant et du champoing. Elle s’est rendue compte que la rentabilité de ce commerce n’est pas négligeable et ce revenu la soutient énormément. Pour stabiliser et régulariser son revenu, elle veut installer un point de vente de ces produits surtout les mèches de toutes sortes. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’avoir une indépendance financière.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy and sell hair accessories

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the ten women of the Sop Naby group, led by Ms. Adama M.. In their loan application, the group describe their business as follows:

“Our business is located in the region of Fatick, in the village of Ndiaye Ndiaye. It is composed of women who are united around a common ideal. Our goal is to help women strengthen their existing skills, combat youth employment and female migration, and improve the lives of our members. The business will consist of retail trading of local foods.”

Original French business description:

«Contexte: Le projet se situ dans la région de Fatick et à l’éco village de Ndiaye Ndiaye. Il regroupe des femmes unies autour d’un même idéal.

Objectifs: Le groupement se fixe comme objectif d’aider les femmes dans leurs domaine de compétence; De lutter contre le chômage des jeunes et l’exode des femmes; D’améliorer les conditions de vie des membres du groupements.

Activités: Le groupement s’est fixé comme activité: Le commerce. Il s’agit d’achat et de vente de produits de consommation local .»

Background:

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Purchase and production of local foods for sale in town market

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
My name is Bilqees B.. I was born in Chichawatni and moved to Kot Rahda Kishan after my marriage. I have two daughters and one son. I am planning to send them to school when they are old enough. My husband works at a yarn factory for a meager income. I have two cows and sell their milk to supplement my husband’s income. My children are growing and so are their expenses. We need to increase our household income so that we can enroll all of our children in a school.
I would like to borrow $675 with my friend who is also my neighbor. We have always helped each other in times of need. My group member is Irshad B., whose husband is a shoemaker.

loans.use: To buy a cow and increase milk production for my business

loans.name: Alataua

texts.en: Alataua is a married mother of five children from the village of Ulutogia Aleipata. Her business is a vegetable garden. Her husband and two sons work on her garden too. Her last loan was used to buy supplies for her vegetable garden. She is applying for this loan in order to keep her children in school and to support her family.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for her plantation and for family expenses

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
A. Rustam is turning 21 this week -- but in spite of his young age, he is already the father of a charming daughter, aged one. 

Rustam used to help his mother isell fish when he was 13 years old. Today he runs his own business and his mother now helps him. Rustam sells fish in the central local market. Rustam’s business is the only source of income for his family as his wife keeps house and looks after their daughter. His business is quite stable with a turnover capital of US$ 2,000. 

Today Rustam requests US$500 for a term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase fish wholesale. This is Rustam's second loan with IMON. He has a good loan repayment record, as his previous loan was paid accurately and in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing fish wholesale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali M. is a 39-year-old trader who runs his small food store in a small village in the Saatli region.  He is married and has three children.  He applied for a loan of  $1200 to improve the conditions of his workplace.

loans.use: To improve conditions of the store

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina S. G. prepares meals from her home in a rural suburb of Pucallpa, Ucayali. For lunch Rosalina serves homemade meals typical of the region such as chicken, beef, or fish with beans, rice, and yucca. At night she has a grill from which she sells delicious grilled meats, fried rice, and "Juane" (a street food made with rice and chicken).

Rosalina is 50 years old, has 2 children, and is happily married. Rosalina loves to cook and work. She is social and loves building relationships with her neighbors and other clients. Rosalina is happy to earn an income, be a productive and positive member of her community, and help her family.

A member of the community bank Las Lumbreras, Rosalina is requesting a loan of s/1200 to repay over 6 months to buy ingredients for her business such as rice, sugar, oil, chicken, condiments, and beef.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food sales

loans.name: Laheli

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30 year old Laheli N.. She is married and has four children aged one, three, six, and eight. In 2002, Laheli established her second-hand clothing business. Laheli has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan to purchase additional stock of used clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe and are then washed, ironed, and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam. Retailers then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation because of their low cost and the general appeal of anything western or modern. Some argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, however, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of used clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 43 years old, has been a member of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) for five years. Among her three children, two of them are still at school age. H. and her husband plant sedges. After each harvest, they sold the short and not-quite good sedges, and keep the good ones to make sedge mats. Good materials and Mrs. H.'s cleverness bring beautiful mats, and all of the mats made are sold very quickly at good prices. After joining TYM Fund, Mrs. H. has more money, so she is able to make more sedge mats. Each day she makes 4 to 5 sedge mats. Her income is about 6 USD per day, which is a huge improvement compared to what she earned before joining TYM Fund. Mrs. H. was able to buy a closet, a T.V. and other furniture for her house. This time she applies for a loan of 575 USD to buy sedge to make sedge mats.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hải, 43 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. 2 trong số 3 người con của chị hiện đang trong độ tuổi đến trường. Nhà trồng cói, sau mỗi vụ gặt về chị thường bán đi số cói ngắn và xấu, thêm tiền đầu tư mua cói tốt về làm. Nguyên liệu tốt cộng với sự khéo tay nên chiếu gia đình chị làm ra đều được tiêu thụ ngay và rất được giá. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ, có thêm nguồn vốn nên số lượng sản phẩm làm ra tăng lên đáng kể. Mỗi ngày làm ra từ 4-5 chiếc chiếu, thu nhập trên dưới 6USD, kinh tế gia đình chị Hải phát triển rõ rệt. Chị đã mua được tủ, tivi cùng nhiều vật dụng có giá trị khác. Vòng vốn này chị Hải làm đơn xin vay 575USD mua thêm cói dệt chiếu.

loans.use: Buy sedge to make sedge mat

loans.name: Mohchehra

texts.en:
Mohchehra is 43 years old, is married and the loving mother of 4 children of school age. She is doing her best to ensure that her children have the best future and a good education. Mohchehra’s husband is currently unemployed, thus Mohchehra's business is the main source of income for her family.

Together with her elder son, who is pictured in the photo, she started her business of selling white salt 5 years ago. She rents a stall in an open air market of Istaravshan, and purchases the white salt wholesale from her suppliers. As time went by, she expanded her business and it now generates a stable income for the family. However, Mohchehra’s children are growing up and the expenses are growing.

Mohchehra dreams of her children being well-educated, but in order to do that Mohchehra is planning to expand her business. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting US$900 to increase stock. Your support will really help this dedicated mother to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To increase stock of white salt.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana has worked for years in a well-known popular market in the city. She is the mother of 5 school-aged children. She earns her income from selling breakfasts in the morning and teas in the afternoons. Her home is located in El Alto city. Every morning she gets up very early to go in to the city, accompanying her two small daughters as they are too young to be left alone. With her loan she will buy consumables to sell and thereby be able to give a better education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Liliana, trabaja hace años en un conocido mercado popular de la ciudad, es madre de 5 hijos en edad escolar, ingreso es de la venta de desayunos en las mañanas y te por la tarde Su domicilio se encuentra en la ciudad de El Alto, cada mañana se levanta muy temprano para bajar a la ciudad en compañía de sus dos pequeñas hijas ya que son muy pequeñas para dejar las solas. Con el crédito comprara insumos para sus ventas y asi poder dar una mejor educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase consumables

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma is a member of Banco Comunal Alondras. She has a partner, is 32 years old and has 1 daughter. She lives with her parents in the traditional neighborhood of Yaracc Yuracc. Together with her spouse she weaves handcrafted fabrics which she learned from her parents and she also has help from workers depending on the demand. She sells to intermediaries who sell to different department stores in the country. Vilma makes carpets, place mats, blankets or other products depending on orders.

Vilma needs a loan of 1600 soles to be invested in buying wool, thread and dye. It is Vilma’s dream to build her house, sell her fabrics directly to the department stores, and set up a stand at the handicrafts market of the town.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras. Vilma es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 1 hija, Vilma vive aun en la casa de sus padres ubicado en el barrio tradicional de Yuracc Yuracc, Vilma junto a su esposo realizan tejidos artesanales en telar, actividad que aprendió de sus padres, Vilma cuenta además con la ayuda de operarios, dependiendo de la demanda que tiene, sus ventas lo realiza a intermediarios que venden en diferentes departamentos del país. Vilma produce, tapices, individuales, frazadas y otros productos dependiendo de los pedidos.

Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, hilo y tintes. Vilma sueña son construir su casa, vender sus productos directamente a otros departamentos y tener un puesto en el mercado artesanal de la ciudad.

loans.use: Vilma needs a loan of 1600 soles to be invested in buying wool, thread, and dye.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Alejandro es un muchacho de 24 años, desde adolescente se dedica al trabajo de electricista, labor que aprendió en el colegio técnico industrial en el que estudiaba su nivel secundario, gracias a su iniciativa y perseverancia pudo perfeccionar sus conocimientos, con los que ahora se desenvuelve eficientemente, por lo que sus servicios son muy solicitados en su pueblo, Santa Rosa.Adicionalmente, en sus horas libres se dedica a la compra y venta de carros, esta actividad le está permitiendo mejorar sus ingresos económicos y sobre todo  apoyar en los gastos de su hogar.Su deseo es aumentar el monto de  inversión de su negocio, con ese objetivo solicita el presente préstamo.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 24 years old and since adolescence has made a living as an electrician, a trade he learned at a technical school when he was in high school. Thanks to his initiative and perseverance he was able to fine-tune his skills, which have developed to the point that his services are highly requested in his town of Santa Rosa. Additionally, in his free time he dedicates himself to buying and selling cars, which helps increase his finances and, more importantly, helps pay household expenses. He wishes to increase his working capital, which is why he's requesting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital for business endeavors (electrician and buying and selling cars)

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn N., 36, and his wife, Mrs. Srey Long, 32, who live along National Road Number Six about twenty Kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1991 and have seven children; five sons and two daughters. Their first son is a construction worker and the second son raise cows. Three of their children study in the local school.

Sorn and his wife have been selling sugar palm juice and fruit for over ten years. Every morning, Sorn climbs up sugar palm trees to collect palm juice and palm fruit to sell in his village and a nearby village by his bicycle. Currently he needs to buy a motorbike to carry his palm fruit and juice to sell. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $400.

loans.use: Sorn would like to purchase a motorbike for carrying sugar palm fruits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.en:
Sanoat S. is 38 years old and lives with her spouse and 4 children. Sanoat works every day, starting very early in the morning, so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her 4 children successfully finish school and enter University. She sells children clothes in the central market of Istaravshan town. Thanks to the support of her spouse, and her own effort, she has been able to expand and grow her business.

With a loan of 2700 Somoni ($800 USD), which she will repay in 12 months, she will buy a greater variety of clothing styles, for a variety of occasions, and a few specific requests from her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more children's clothing for sale.

loans.name: Geiter

texts.es: Geiter tiene 54 años de edad, es padre soltero, vive con sus dos hijos que estudian y lo apoyan mucho. El se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 6 años, a causa de quedarse sin empleo en una constructora en donde trabajaba. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene contacto directo con sus clientes y sobre todo dar un buen trato y confianza es lo principal, nos menciona. Le es rentable, ya que el mismo es el chofer de su motocarro y las ganancias son sólo para él. Le va muy bien. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con la cantidad mencionada quiere mandar a reparar su vehículo para trabajar  sin inconvenientes, además quiere arreglar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Geiter is 54 years old, a single father, and lives with his two children who are students and support him a great deal. He has dedicated himself to transporting passengers for six years, having been left unemployed by a construction company he worked for. What he likes about his work is that he has direct contact with his customers and, most of all he can provide quality service and confidence which are key to his business he tells us. It is profitable for him, since he himself is the driver of his motorcar and his earnings go directly to him. It has been going very well. This is the second time he requests a loan with MFP. With the quantity mentioned, he would like to send his vehicle for repairs so he can work without inconveniences. Additionally, he would like to make repairs to the infrastructure of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs to his motocar.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Además trabaja como albañil en la población.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Chojasivi de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a sus ocho hijos  de los cuales los dos mayores le ayudan en su trabajo y así colaboran con el sustento de la familia. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera,  de mediana calidad  y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Eduardo is dedicated to raise cattle. His milk production is sold to PIL Andina (Milk Industrialization Plant). He lives in the Chojasivi community of the Loa Andes province in the La Paz department which is located four hours from the capital city of La Paz.

He lives with his eight children which two of them help him with work and collaborate with sustenance of the family. The loan will be used to buy a milk cow of medium quality and increase the production of milk as well as their earnings. It is their first credit with Impro. The evaluation conducted qualifies him for the loan.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
N. Malohat is 31 years old. She is married with two children. She started her own business 11 years ago because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family's expenses. Malohat sells confectioneries such as candies, cookies and pastries in the local market.  Her family is living with her husband's parents and the generated income allows Malohat to support her large household. Malohat dreams of her children getting a higher education. 

Today she requests a loan of 3000 Somoni for the term of 12 months. She is going to use the funds to purchase a wider range of confectionery goods.  With the income she plans to buy her own store and educate her children. Malohat thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time, as she did with her previous loan.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history.  It was a key post along the Silk Road and is where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It is famous for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Enlarge the range of goods and with the generated income purchase her own store

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Tan P., 50, grows and sells rice in the Prey Veng province. She is married and has two children, both of whom still live at home. Her husband is a farmer. Tan typically makes about USD $2 each day, and would like a loan to purchase a water pump to irrigate her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: Икром 54 летний мужчина ,отец пятерых детей.Работает штукатурщиком на заказ.Его работа не достаточна для полного обеспечения семьи,хотя ему помогают его три сына, которые работают разнорабочими.Жена Икрома занимается воспитанием внуков.Кроме своей работы Икром занимается куплей и продажей мелкого скота.У него на сегодня 10 баранов и 12 коз.Невестки Икрома занимаются прядением козьей шерсти и её  продажей.Друзья Икрома посоветовали в кредит закупить ещё несколько голов скота,для чего и обратился Икром в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Ikrom is a 54 years old father of five. He is a wall plastering contractor. This job does not bring enough money to sustain Ikrom's family, even though three of Ikrom's sons help him. Ikrom's wife is busy raising grandchildren. To supplement his income, Ikrom maintains a cattle farm. Today, the farm contains 10 sheep and 12 goats. Ikrom's daughters-in-law weave and sell goat wool. Ikrom's friends recommended him to apply for Microinvest loan to purchase a few more animals.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle farming

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine sells clothes and sarongs. She has been in this business for a long time. She travels to Cotonou to purchase her clothes and sarongs to sell in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 48 years old and married with 7 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo is 45 years old and she is married with four children. She sells foodstuffs like palm oil, melon seeds, rice, etc. She hopes to obtain a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Galbinur

texts.en: Galbinur is a 30-year-old single man living in Khachmaz town.  He owns an Internet cafe and has been in this business for one year.  He would like to improve his Internet cafe and have a lot of customers.  He will use the loan of 2000 AZN to buy computers and the necessary things for improving and growing his business.

loans.use: To buy computers for his Internet cafe.

loans.name: Kosimjon

texts.en: I. Kosimjon is a 26-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two children. He runs a business raising and selling cattle and has five years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Kosimjon has become a very successful businessman. He has a friendly family who always try to help each other. Thus his wife helps him with his business. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing. Now Kosimjon wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. For that, he applied for a loan of 5,000 Somoni. Kosimjon thanks all lenders for their support. With your help Kosimjon can get ahead. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Naiheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Naiheng S. (in the picture with her daughter) is fifty-five years old and married to Mr. Sokha Preab, who is fifty-four years old. They were married in 1979 and have seven children: three sons, all of whom are in school, and four daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives outside the family home, one daughter is a garment factory worker, and the other one is a tailor.  The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Naiheng began selling groceries at the beginning of 2009. She buys grocery items at the market in Phnom Penh for resale from her house. Her husband has worked for the water supply authority in Phnom Penh since 1980. Naiheng is applying for a loan to purchase a sewing machine and build a shop for her daughter who is a tailor.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and build a tailoring shop for her daughter who is a tailor.

loans.name: Etonam

texts.fr:
Résidente du quartier d’adidogomé, cette femme  a débuté en 2006 le commerce des pagnes et tissus. Elle vend ses pagnes au marché local d’adidogomé et à domicile. Ses clientes deviennent de plus en plus nombreuses, elle voudrait mieux les satisfaire avec un plus grand stock, elle sollicite pour se faire un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes et  une douzaine de tissus.
Etant célibataire, le revenu qu’elle gagne de cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses charges.
texts.en:
A resident of the Adidogomé neighborhood, this woman began selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) and other fabrics in 2006. She sells her "pagnes" at the local market of Adidogomé and out of her home. Her customers are becoming more and more numerous, so she would like to better satisfy their needs by having a wide inventory. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 lengths of "pagne" and a dozen fabrics.

As a single woman, she is in this business to be able to support herself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of "pagnes" and other fabrics

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
P. Nguyễn Thị is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. P. is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, P. operates a family member's business primarily making and selling fried foods in the local community. P. has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month.

P. is the leader of a five member group seeking a loan from SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ngô Nội 05 (5).

P. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. P. is requesting a loan from SEDA for the first time. She is requesting a loan of 4,256,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. P. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. No. 20211020026.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Nguyễn Thị Y. is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business running a general store. No.20211020027.

2. Nguyễn Thị L. is a 43-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. No. 20211020028.

3. Ngô Thị T. is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business. No. 20211020029.

4. Nguyễn Thị O. is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business running a general store. No. 20211020030.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

P. Nguyễn Thị (20211020026) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. P. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ngô Nội 05 (5).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các P. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh dO. chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thực phẩm chiên trong cộng đồng địa P.. P. thực hiện công việc kinh dO. này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, P. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND. P. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh dO. của cô ấy/ anh ấy. P. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.256.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị Y. (20211020027) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là kinh dO. cửa hàng bách hóa.

2. Nguyễn Thị L. (20211020028) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Ngô Thị T. (20211020029) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành công việc kinh dO. chế tạo hàng nội thất.

4. Nguyễn Thị O. (20211020030) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là kinh dO. cửa hàng bách hóa.

Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DO. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for selling fried foods

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena es socia del Banco Comunal Kusirikuy que significa Alegrate en quechua.
Magdalena es viuda, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Magdalena sen dedica al alquiler D. salones D. recepciones, además brinda servicios D. decoración, preparación D. comida, elaboración D. tortas para diferentes eventos.
Magdalena necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. telas para decoración y harina.
Magdalena sueña con comprar un carro para transportar sus productos y comprar un horno para la preparación D. tortas.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of the village bank called Kusirikuy which means rejoice in Quechua.

Magdalena is a widow, 45 years old, and has three children. Magdalena is in the business of renting rooms for receptions. She also provides services like decorating, preparing food, and preparing cakes for different events.

Magdalena needs a loan of 2100 soles to buy fabric for decoration and flour.

Magdalena dreams of buying a car to transport her products and buying an oven for preparing her cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabric for decoration and flour

loans.name: Yemisi

texts.en: Yemisi is 49 and is married with 5 children. She has a restaurant and also sells palm oil. She is requesting a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama D. est âgé de 38 ans et  père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille monogame dans le  quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire pour des raisons sociales, Monsieur Adama D. a tenté plusieurs activités économiques notamment, la vente des habits , des chaussures, des tasses etc, mais sans succès. Alors décida de s’initier à l’achat vente d’articles divers de boutique. Nanti de 2 ans d’expériences dans cette activité, il maitrise bien  les tenant et aboutissant du commerce général, qu’il a appris auprès de son grand frère.
 Pour améliorer son activité, Monsieur Adama D. décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel, après avoir remboursé par anticipation le premier prêt.  Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali.) auprès des grossistes et vend en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans sa boutique à une clientèle  composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Adama D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 52 500 FCFA qi servira à  agrandir sa boutique et à assurer certaines dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Adama D. is 38 years old and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in a monogamous household in the neighborhood of Hérémakono, north of Bougouni in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Adama could not attend school for social reasons. He tried several business activities, notably trading in clothes, shoes and cups, but without success. Then he decided to learn about trading in sundries. His elder brother taught him the ins and outs of a general store, and now he has two years of experience in this activity. To improve his business, Adama decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso to buy various items for his store. This is his second individual loan, after having paid off his first loan in advance. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako, the capital city of the Republic of Mali, and sells retail (cash and credit) to customers living in his neighborhood. With this loan, Adama expects to make a profit of 52,500 CFA francs (US$117) a month, which he will use to expand his store and provide for some needs of his family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items for his store

loans.name: Mami

texts.en:
Mami R. is currently in the business of selling groundnut phaste and is requesting a loan to purchase baking materials .  

Mami is 39 years old and is Married with a husband that is a peasant . She has 4 children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bigger backery.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase baking materials

loans.name: Margaret  Achieng

texts.en:
Margaret is separated and she takes care of her five children: Yuder (27), Hellen (25), Jared (15), Winnie (14), and Vincent (9). Margaret has been in the charcoal sales business for two years. She was introduced to KADET by current borrowers and she has no previous credit history. Margaret intends to use her loan to increase her stock of charcoal ahead of the rainy season to help maintain or increase her income. Margaret's business is located in a highly populated area and she is the only one selling charcoal thus she gets good sales. With her profits, Margaret intends to add some groceries and operate a grocery business on the side. Margaret hopes to open a wholesale business one day and distribute charcoal to other vendors as she is a hardworking entrepreneur.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil. She is 63 years old and a wife and mother of seven children. 
Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernel. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil which is used to prepare many local dishes like fried fish and pastries. 
Georgina supplies food vendors for their meal preparation. However, her production is on the low side as a result of too little working capital to afford a processing machine. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine to reduce the drudgery and manual effort required to produce larger quantities. She believes this loan will enable her to save more toward her child’s education.

loans.use: To purchase palm kernel in bulk and an electric milling machine

loans.name: Ahemaa Group

texts.en: Victoria is forty five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Victoria is a trader. She trades in printed textile materials. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ahemaa ’, meaning queens. Most of the group members are either into trading or farming activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Victoria, the group leader is in the middle of the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy supplies of printed textile material

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.en:
This group was formed by Gladys Lopez V. who gathered 16 women to work in the Women’s Entrepreneurship program after she heard about it from a friend. The 16 women of the Kuña Katupyry Committee are currently entering their fourth loan cycle and are excited to continue their growth and progress.

The women are enthusiastic about their work and support each other in their businesses and loan repayments. They all work independently, selling clothes, shoes, food, dressmaking materials, etc. They will each receive between 1,200,000 and 200,000 PYG to buy sugar, meat, flour, eggs, noodles, candy and clothing in order to improve their businesses and increase profits to help their families and improve their lives.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Virgen del Carmen (which is the name of a saint of Peru), are clients of Asociación Arariwa.  This communal bank consists of 12 members in Cusco. All the group members live in Cusco. Some of the members are single, while some are married, or live with their common law spouse and have children. The members of Virgen del Carmen are involved in various commercial activities including selling clothing. One of the members is a seamstress and waiter.  

One of the members, Edith, was born in Cusco, and lives in Santa Ana, a neighborhood of Cusco. She is 39 years old and married with 2 children. She works as a teacher and also operates a bookstore on Calle Teatro. She makes 2,625 soles per month as a teacher and sells about 7,500 soles per month in books, which is the equivalent of approximately $920 and $2,600. With this loan, she will invest in her bookstore.

All of the members of Virgen el Carmen appreciate and thank you for the loan and promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To use as business capital, including for a bookstore.

loans.name: Hol

texts.en: Mrs. Hol S., 39, is a married woman who is blessed with five teenage kids. They live together in a wooden house located in Siem Reap province, where Hol S. has built a grocery store, in which she sells small grocery items to earn a living. Two of the children are employed and provided their little revenue to meet their family’s financial crisis. Hol S. got married many years ago to Mr. Mao Sor, who is 44 and currently works in construction. Hol S. has been constructing a new house for a year but the building is still not completed due to lack of money. Hol S. has requested a loan to enable her to finish building the new house.

loans.use: To finish building a new house

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma Comeda is 45 years old and married with two adult children. She has been raising pigs for three years now – an enterprise she enjoys very much. Thelma started out with two pigs; now she has seven and she earns about 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. She lives in the village of Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Thelma joined PMPC in 2007. She has taken out a previous loan from PMPC of 3,000 PHP and is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. Thelma plans to use her loan to buy another pig and more hog-fattening products for her pigs. Although she currently lives in a hut by the sea, Thelma would like to build a better house for herself and her husband one day. She hopes that she can use the profits from her business to do just that. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To buy one more pig and more hog-fattening products

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita G. is a 48-year-old mother of two children who are 23 and 25 years old. She joined ASHI in 1996, wanting to achieve her dream of giving her children a better kind of life and rise above from poverty. Loans she had requested all throughout her membership had been very significant in changing her life and her family’s. Because of them, she has able to have a fishing and fish selling business as a source of her family daily finances as well as giving her husband a livelihood to manage. Anita’s husband is the one that manages the motor fishing boat she purchased through her previous loan from ASHI. She sells the fish in the market. When business capital and profits from the business are larger enough, she purchases a large volume of fish from other fishermen and trades them to other neighboring municipalities. Since she has paid up her previous loan, she requests a much larger amount of loan for the same purpose. Through this, her business will grow and eventually she will accomplish her dream of helping her husband support the needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase another motor boat

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
la señora Maria de la Cruz R. tiene 48 años de edad, es viuda con 5 hijos, tres varones y dos mujeres Maria tiene un año de tener su negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion. todos los dias abre muy temprano y cierra como a las 9 de la noche.
para surtir su negocio viaja a comprar la mercaderia ya que es mas barato en la ciudad de Choluteca luego la transporta hacia su casa de habitacion. el credito lo esta solicitando para comprar varios productos al por mayor y asi tener que viajar menos, ya que esto le genera gastos..
tambien desea comprar utiles escolares como lapices, cuadernos, borradores, marcadores etc ya que su negocio se encuentra frente al colegio.
las ventas suben bastante durante la epoca escolar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria de la Cruz R. is 48 years old; she is a widow with 5 children, 3 males and 2 women. Maria has had her business for about a year, which is located in a room in her home. Everyday she opens very early and closes about 9 p.m.

To stock her business, Maria, travels to buy the merchandize since it is cheaper in the city of Choluteca and later she transports it to her home. The loan will be used to buy various products wholesale, and that way she will have to travel less, since that incurs some expenses.

She also wishes to buy school supplies like pencils, notebooks, erasers, markers, etc. since her business is in front of a school.

Sales increase a lot during school season.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fat, spaghetti, spices, churros, refreshments, oil, beans, tortillas, bread, cookies, juices, sugar, rice, cereal, soups, tablets, soaps, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel M. Z., tiene la edad de 43 años, está casado, y tiene 4 hijos de 18,14,14 y 9 años. El crédito lo quiere para dar asistencia a su finca, el desea realizar unos trabajos en la finca y así lograr que los cultivos produzcan más. La idea es mejorar y aumentar la capacidad de producción y aumentar el área del cultivo.  Don Gabriel cuenta con área de diversos cultivos en producción tal es el caso del cultivo del café y otros. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento y lograr una mejor calidad y  obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de su cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Gabriel también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mayor estabilidad económica, y así poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Gabriel M. Z. is 43 years old, married with 4 children ages 18, 14, 14 and 9. The loan that he is requesting will be used to support his farm. He would like to make some upgrades to the farm and in this way increase the crop production. The idea is to improve and augment the capacity of production and increase the cultivatable land. Mr. Gabriel has land with the ability to produce diverse crops such as coffee and others. He would like to do sufficient maintenance and obtain better quality produce and acquire the most income possible when it comes time to harvest. This is the first time that he has requested a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very pleased with the services they provide. Mr. Gabriel has worked for several years in agriculture. In the future, he hopes to improve his quality of life and have better economic stability in order to continue to grow both as a person and as a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make upgrades to his farm

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 40 years old and married with five children. Her children are doing well in school. She is a hardworking and friendly woman. She sells groceries and loaves of bread to make a living. She loves her business and family dearly and she hopes to help her husband meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more groceries and loaves of bread to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and loaves of bread to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy S. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old and is widowed.

Nancy owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Nancy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC.
