Nancy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tulwanirewamu Group, Kampala

texts.en:
W. Joy is a 38-year-old female farmer based in Naluvule, Kampala. She has five children, all going to school.

Being a small-scale farmer has not helped Joy dispense with hard financial circumstances since she began five years ago. Being a farmer, she has worked hard to grapple with a myriad of problems such as the constant chicken diseases that have drastically affected her poultry.

With a little help from friends Joy has managed to overcome most of her problems. In a month, she says she makes close to 80,000 shillings from selling her chickens. Her future plan is to transform her poultry farm into a large scale farm entity that will support her and her family in the near future.

With this loan, Joy also wants to give her poultry venture a renewed lease of life.

loans.use: To purchase new chicks for her poultry farm

loans.name: Gilmar

texts.es:
El Sr. Gilmar P. Guzmán tiene 42 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos, esta casado hace 18 años, en vista al numero de hijos que tiene la casa le resulta muy pequeña para que estén cómodos motivo por el cual solicitan un crédito para la ampliación de la vivienda, al tener ingresos mínimos con el servicio de transporte le resultaría imposible realizar seméjate inversión. 

El nos cuenta que su mayor desea es en un futuro poder ampliar su casa de tal manera que todos sus hijo puedan vivir comodamente, y no sufran por falta de casa como el lo hizo.
texts.en:
Gilmar P. Guzmán is 42 years old, has six children, and has been married for 18 years. Because of the number of children he has, his house is too small for them to be comfortable. For this reason, he is asking for a loan to add on to his home. His income from his taxi business is low, so it is impossible for him to carry out this project alone. He says that his greatest desire for the future is to be able to add enough space to his house that all his children can live comfortably and not suffer from a lack of adequate housing as he did.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Sakit

texts.en:
Sakit is 35 years old and an internally displaced person from Fuzuli city. He currently lives in the Fuzuli region, an area still under Azerbaijan's jurisdiction. He is married and has two children, ages 13 and 14. His business is a stand from which he sells fruits and vegetables all year.

Sakit is seeking a loan of 2,000 Azerbaijani New Manats to expand his stand so that it would provide shade for his produce. He worries that the vegetables go bad too quickly under the heat of the sun during the summers and freeze during the winters. By building additional shelves on his stand, he could increase the shelf-life of the produce he sells. 

Sakit hopes that by keeping his produce fresh longer, he can decrease the number of trips he takes to purchase them at the various bazaars, some of which are located quite a distance away.

loans.use: To expand his stand so that it would provide shade for his produce

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.en:
E. Saidjon is married and has one little kid who he is very proud of since they are struggling to get ahead. With the faith that his family will have a bright future, he started a business of processing and selling dried apricots 7 years ago. He is experienced in this kind of business, and that allows him to expand his clientele day by day. 

Right now Saidjon requests 4000 Somoni. He is going to spend the loan purchasing dried apricots to process and sell. With your help, Saidjon will be able to improve his living conditions. 

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy dried apricots to expand his business

loans.name: Yolinisa

texts.en: Yolinisa P. is from the village of Sangkol. She is 36 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Yolinisa owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Yolinisa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Yolinisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolinisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Yolinisa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Yolinisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mrs. Pha So Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has eighteen people who live in Doun Pheu village, Takeo province. Mrs. Pha S., who was born in 1961, is the village bank president, selected by the other members. The members will use their portion of the loan to support their various businesses.

Mrs. Pha S. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She faces an obstacle in that it is time to plow her field but she does not have enough money to support doing S.. S., to improve production, she is seeking a loan to hire a plowing machine to plow her field. With the rest of the loan she plans to buy fertilizer.

Mrs. Pha S. is a widow with three children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the other is studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To hire a plowing machine to plow her field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mr. Leang S. (in photo) is 50 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Phally Nang, is 45 years old. They have been married since 1986 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. One of the children is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment factory workers, one is a construction worker, and another one attends school. Mr. Leang S. and his wife live in a small village across the Mekong River approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Leang and his wife are farmers. They grow gourds and cucumbers on their farmland in the village. The couple does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain their farm. Leang is asking for his first loan in the amount of $700 to provide capital to purchase these items.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married to a carpenter with whom they have six children; four of her children go school. She gave birth to twins who are three months old.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

Previously, she owned a ladies' salon. She now owns a stall selling bananas in Kalerwe market. She buys bananas from the villages of Masaka District and uses public transport to buy bananas once a week. She doesn’t have any other side job. She sells to all kinds of people, both retail and wholesale. Justine works six days a week.

Her business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She aspires to being able to buy a plot of land. Justine decided to join MCDT, because of their timely loans and also services that are nearby. She resides in and rents a two-room house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses are rent, medication, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Tipapa Ole

texts.en:
Tipapa Ole R., 32 years old, supports two members of his family. His spouse is Safina R. and they are blessed with one child. He does wheat farming which he has been doing for the last five years successfully, due to good climatic conditions and a ready market for produce in his area.
 
This being his second loan, he is planning to spend twenty thousand to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his five-acre wheat farm and the remaining ten thousand on spraying the wheat. His plan for the anticipated profits is that he will expand his wheat farming to large-scale farming.

His hope is that he will become a large-scale farmer and own some farm machinery. He is a hardworking man and determined to achieve his target.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his five-acre wheat farm and pay for spraying the wheat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flowers and pots.
